Reviews.Title: “Great value for money would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: sarahrutt
Reviews.Content: Paris hotels seem hugely expensive but this was a great hotel with lovely service at a really reasonable price (considering it is Paris!) Although on quite a busy road there was minimal noise and I slept brilliantly, the rooms were of a good size for a city centre and very comfortable. The staff were great and couldn't do enough for us both pre arrival and during our trip. The hotel is right opposite the RER station which goes straight through to both Gare du Nord (for Eurostar) and to the main airports. It was about ten minutes to nearest metro but right on the doorstep of Jardin Du Luxemborg which was a lovely place to relax after site seeing all day. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and the bar seemed to offer a good choice of food and drink with a little outside terrace which got the evening sun. The design of the hotel and "arty" feel was also brilliant and of much higher standard than I expected. All in all an excellent stay and I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a citybreak”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_Hunter123
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely boutique hotel excellently located just adjacent to the Jardin du Luxembourg, which is a lovely place to sit and relax after a day on your feet in Paris. Whilst only a 10 minute walk from Notre Dame, it feels nicely removed from the tourist traps. It is also located about 1 minute walk from the RER with direct connections to CDG and Orly airports and the Eurostar Gare du Nord. Very friendly staff, particularly Moustafa on the front desk. Rooms are nicely decorated (as are the public areas) in reds/blacks/whites, with very comfortable beds. The rooms aren't massive but certainly adequate and given Paris is so beautiful I wouldn't have wanted to spend much time in my room anyway. Great shower in the bathroom and clean throughout. There is a decent coffee bar Luco attached to the hotel serving buffet breakfast (not included in the rate). But at £130 per night in central Paris, I still think the hotel is excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed review”
Reviews.Author: anairam1980
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris with a friend in October 2011 and when I booked the hotel was 180 here on trip advisor. The hotel had mostly good reviews, is close to the subway, was very good priced, specially considering the prices in Paris. The bedroom was very small, and the bathroom quite large but the drain was clogged the entire time I was there. In fact the room was under maintenance when I checked in and I had to leave my luggage in the reception and walk around until it was done, but the problem was not solved even after many complains. The biggest issue I had is that I don't think the hotel will be able to keep its standard. The walls were dirty, even though looked like were newly renovated. I just think that it will go down from here, so I suggest future travelers to check if the rating is falling, specially a few years form now. The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “One Baby-Free Week In Paris”
Reviews.Author: LilyR1982
Reviews.Content: We left our seven month old baby at home with his Grandmother to indulge and spoil ourselves for our seventh wedding anniversary in Paris. We were given a choice of two rooms. The room we chose had a view of the Luxembourg gardens. It was well appointed and kept very clean. The breakfast we had each day was great. The staff were all very professional and incredibly helpful, particularly Mustapha who we regularly chatted with and practised our French with! We really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: kat159
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights in Feb 2012. Room was small but very well appointed - nioe bed linen, kettle and mugs provided, good hairdryer. Bathroom had great shower - just what you need at the end of a hard day's sightseeing in Paris - and decent toiletries. Bed was very comfortable and the room windows opened. Our room overlooked gardens to the side and there was very little traffic noise through the night. Staff were friendly. Hotel bistro food was simple but good although service at breakfast was not as good as evening. Hotel is in a fairly quiet residential area - very close to the Jardins de Luxembourg which is a beautiful outdoor space - but has good connections. 2 mins walk from Luxembourg RER station (which goes straight to CdG airport) and about 5 mins walk from nearest Metro (Rennes).

Reviews.Title: “hotel observatoire luxembourg”
Reviews.Author: JSC2010
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very clean, comfortable bed. The staff was wonderful and spoke english. This hotel is across the street from the RER B train to CDG (get into the first car of the train when leaving CDG) Hotel is conveniently located to Notre Dame and the Seine. Breakfast was included in my room rate and was sufficient for my needs and convenient. Great place to stay for a first timer. About 1/4 mile from metro (Saint Michel), although you can easily transfer from the RER B at Luxembourg to other metro stops.

Reviews.Title: “A small hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Cypruslyn
Reviews.Content: This hotel has its own restaurant and is situated opposite the Luxembourg gardens and next to the RER and a bus stop. A great base for visiting local sights such as The Louvre, Notre Dame and many museums. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The hotel is clean and the rooms are well decorated with tea and coffee provided. We stayed in a quiet room at the back which overlooked some gardens. The bathroom is modern and spotlessly clean with a shower. Baths are available but are in the front rooms overlooking St Micheal boulevard. Overall a good place to stay and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel... fantastic experience...”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMx
Reviews.Content: During the month of January I spent 1 week in France for holidays.. I stayed one night at Hotel Observatoire since my partner chose it for being convenient to his office… never stayed in that area in previous visits in Paris so did not know what to expect… fortunately we were GLADLY surprised… First of all, the hotel is located straight on RER B, right outside of the Luxembourg station, literally 1 minute walk door to door… hence it is very convenient upon arrival from Charles De Gaulle with luggage… bus 38 right outside takes you to all the sights in the Paris and to city centre… or you can walk in this truly parisian area… the hotel has a lot of character and personality… it is truly boutique, just 5 floors with elevator and a handful of rooms per floor… the service was attentive and efficient at all times… breakfast is included in the room price and it is absolutely delicious… pastries, coffee, cold cuts, some fruits, cereals… the rooms are on the small side (remember, this is Paris, not Asia!) but are super cosy and nicely decorated… the bathrooms are tiny but modern with everything you may need… the mattress is fantastic and the bedding is excellent… good towels as well, heating, flat screen TV and great views over Jardin Luxembourg… In general, I would DEFINITELY recommend this hotel… in the past I have stayed in other hotels (Hotel College du France, Mercure Opera Cusset, hostels, etc.) and by far, this is the best value for money (around 100 euros per night) in town… In the same week we also stayed at the Le Six Hotel, from the same Group, you can see the review there…

Reviews.Title: “Nice location; lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: barusso
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay at the Hotel. if coming from CDG, the RER lets you off just outside the hotel, so this is quite convenient. We enjoyed being near Luxembourg gardens As with most European hotels, the rooms are on the smaller side (but are probably standard for at least France), but are extremely clean, have been updated and have a comfortable bed. The hotel front desk staff were quite cordial and helpful. i would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great night sleep”
Reviews.Author: Sinatrapug
Reviews.Content: The hotel reception staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The bed was the best we slept in on our trip - so comfy. The hotel was lovely and quiet, The only down side of our stay was the breakfast room. The lady working in here was rude and cleaned tables by sweeping her hand over them and brushing the crumbs on the ground.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: renetn
Reviews.Content: Good things: - Like other reviewers noted, a great central location to visit many Paris attractions. It's right next to the Luxembourg station on RER B, which goes to CDG and Massy. - Nice, comfy beds and bedding. - Quiet (I am a light sleeper). - Rooms and hotel are nicely decorated. - Nice front desk staff. Rooms and bathroom are small. But this is the same if you stay in the middle of any big cities in the world. My French co-workers love to come to America and stay in our spacious hotels and drive our spacious freeways. Not so good: - The safe is small. My Dell laptop doesn't fit. (I also stayed at a nearby Paris hotel, and my laptop fitted into that safe). - The hotel is small. So all rooms are near the elevator. You will hear the elevator running. This is probably typical of hotels in central Paris. - No drawers in desk or bedside tables (to place your little items).

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Liam B
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with very friendly staff in a great location in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Faskally
Reviews.Content: Arriving from Charles de Gaulle could not be easier with the exit from RER just 50 metres from the Hotel. Staff charming and Helpfull. Rooms on the small side but have all been renovated. Some distance from Restaurants but Buses stop outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Best Little Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jan747
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a week in Paris, and our stay at the Hotel Observatoire was absolute perfection. The Left Bank location is central with the Jardin de Luxembourg just a block away, and walking distance to many sights including Cluny Museum, Notre Dame, Louvre, the metro. Rooms are very clean, terrific beds, modern bathrooms. I have saved the best for last -- the staff. Friendly, highly professional and competent, patient, resourceful, there are no words truly adequate to describe the quality of assistance offered to guests at this hotel. We mainly had contact with Moustafa and Nicolas, who did everything possible to make our stay a happy one. We hope to return to Paris, and will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: luckytorontonians
Reviews.Content: Stayed here five nights October this year and five nights two years ago. Great little hotel. Helpful, kind, welcoming staff. Rooms newly decorated, quiet, clean, beautiful. We just love this place. Close to public transportation and walking distance to many major attractions. Luxembourg Gardens are just across the street. Will definitely stay here again the next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: YYAY
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were in Paris in the midst of Fashion week and an unprecedented heat-wave last month. While the rest of Paris decided that it was autumn despite the 28˚C and kept the air-conditioning to the minimum, the newly refurbished Hotel Observatoire, had the comfort of the guests in mind and kept the room cool. The hotel is relatively central and if you are taking the train (RER) room CDG airport, the station exit is literally right in-front of the hotel. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are bigger then what we had expected and the bathroom was very very spacious too. All recently updated and outfitted with new hardwares and decor. The bed is super comfy which is so crucial after a long day of sightseeing. We really have no complains for this revitalized hotel. If any, perhaps we only wished that the metro was a bit nearer, however, we very quickly found the way around that by using the RER. For a quiet and very comfortable respite in the bz St Germain / Latin quarter, we would definitely recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “pleasure in paris”
Reviews.Author: barry r
Reviews.Content: my wife just treated us to four great days in paris and stayed at this hotel found rooms small but spotless the maids do a great job . we found the desk staff pleasant and extremly helpfull and all spoke perfect english .3o secs walk to the ReR 15 minutes walk to notre damn and 5 minutes to a couple of decent restaurants in sorbonne square a couple of reasonable priced pubs on route to the partheon make for an ideal location . my one and only complaint and it is only a minor complaint the rooms could do with a couple of draws to help with storage

Reviews.Title: “Initially surprised and not pleasently. Overall a good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: ZeeHunter
Reviews.Content: After a full day of travel from Rome, we arrived and the elevator was out of order. We had 4 pieces of luggage, 2 over 50lbs and no one offered to help us take them up the steep narrow stairs to our room on the third floor. The room we had was small and a tight fit with luggage. I'm 6'6" and could not sit on the toilet without opening the shower door to put my left knee into. Water pressure was great, plenty of hot water and room in the shower. Beds were the most comfortable we had during our 3 week stay in Italy and France. Even the Westin heavenly beds were not as comfortable. Pillows nice as well. Rooms were clean, but with a dark blue carpet everything shows up. Could of used a once over around the edges but overall good. The Metro (train) track is right under the sidewalk and it rattles through the whole building all day and most of the night. Walking ten miles plus a day helped with getting to sleep. The gardens are close and quite nice to relax and share a bottle of wine with some cheese n bread. Plenty of quiet places to sit and enjoy the grounds. Bus stops are right across the street so always easy access to locations in Paris. I agree, rooms are well insulated from neighbors noise. Just the train sounded like a jet taking off in the distance every few minutes at night. The staff was always helpful on direction or suggestions for good restaurants. Breakfast was included and plenty to eat and select from.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and great location”
Reviews.Author: Deb E
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent our last of 14 nights in France at the Observatoire Luxembourg--partly for its excellent proximity to the RER so that we could return easily to the airport, and partly because it was so close to great shopping and dining. The hotel is simply charming in its appearance, with our room quite large and bed comfy, and the staff helpful. However, we were on the main floor, and we found it rather noisy early in the morning--we recommend getting a room higher up!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful first trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ken and Jean K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located, a small cozy place with excellent personalized attention that you would not expect in larger hotels. The room was clean; it seemed well sound-proof and we did not hear any noise from 'neighbors' even though all the rooms around were full. In particular, what made our trip very memorable was the help provided by Moustafa even during the preparation for the vacaction. His services were thorough, he was very friendly and cordial. We would not have made this trip to Paris had it not been for Moustafa. Also, it was an absolute pleasure to be in a 100% non-smoking environment.

Reviews.Title: “Okay price, good location, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: BonnieWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby and restaurant area was very clean. The front desk people were "okay" at best. Not overly helpful at any time. The biggest downfall was that the cleaning staff was obviously rifling through our luggage. The pockets were opened,and our bugbag zipper broken. Upon reporting to the front desk, they said they were sorry but did nothing more about it. Nothing was missing as we never left any valuables in the room. They do have an in-room safe, and I highly recommend using it. The location was very close to the metro which was really nice, and close to the gardens. But if you are uncomfortable with the subway, then everything else is quite far. But if you are comfortable with it, then the location is nice. Breakfast was okay. Rooms small, average, nice bathrooms. Quiet hotel, both within the hotel and from the noise outside. I had an okay stay, for the little amount of time you spend in the room, but would stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Nice Location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: PAISilverSpring_Md
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Hotel Luxembourg on two separate occasions for a total of 6 nights in September, 2011, when celebrating our 40th anniversary. The hotel is charming, very clean, and in a great location. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful in every way. For example, when forgot to bring an electrical converter to charge our camera, the front desk staff loaned us a converter for the entire visit. They also are very good at giving necessary information to tourists and speak several languages each. Mr. Moustafa, in particular, was most helpful and went out of his way to make sure that our 40th anniversary trip to Paris was memorable. We plan to return to Paris, and this hotel in particular, many, many time in the future.

Reviews.Title: “best location ever”
Reviews.Author: tami a
Reviews.Content: I've stayed four days in this cozy cute hotel in mid september 2011.The hotel had just been renovated' so everything was brand new and modern.My room faced a quiet road with a wonderful view of a local abby gardens...The staff was proffesional and friendly, all speaking perfect english! All together- room and location- were beyond expectation...Highly recommended to all.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: cat
Reviews.Content: Just a jewel of a boutique hotel. Great Parisian flair, some rooms overlooking a garden in the Latin Quarter. RER station on the corner, six blocks from Notre Dame and right across the street from the Luxembourg Gardens. Very friendly and generously friendly staff. Has a cafe attached to it where we had breakfast every day. Comfortable rooms, perhaps the bathrooms are a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Very Highly Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Charlie S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at L'Hôtel Observatoire Luxembourg for six nights. First contact with staff was a telephone call to confirm our arrival; made to feel welcome even then. Upon arrival, even though we were early, the staff accommodated us by preparing our room quickly. Staff is very warm & welcoming. Amazing decor. Our room was also amazing: bathroom's shower is spa quality, stocked mini bar, and a home-away-from-home ambiance that sets the tone for a wonderful stay in Paris. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “When in Paris, there's no better place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: D T
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Observatoire Luxembourg is the perfect hotel. Moustafa went above and beyond any concierge to accommodate us to make our stay at his hotel as well as his city, perfect, happy and easy. If only all concierge had as much character and care as Moustafa - imagine how much more enjoyable travel could be! He's worth his weight in gold and is truly an honorable and admirable man. The rooms are new, fresh, clean and nice sized for two people. The shower is a good size, the water hot and the water pressure amazing. The blow dryer in the rooms is a professional brand which was a first for me. The location is prime including the fact that the hotel is quiet for Paris! Albeit, our stay was in mid-August so I don't know how much of an impact that represents but I doubt any. The metro is steps away...as are the gardens and the Latin Quarter. The view from our room was gorgeous. When we weren't staring out at the garden views from the window, we had the flat screen TV to watch. There was more than enough room for our luggage as well as a place to store in the closet. We wouldn't think of staying anywhere other than the Hotel Observatoire Luxembourg when in Paris. You shouldn't either!

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing experience first time over seas!!”
Reviews.Author: Meazzki
Reviews.Content: No worries, no problems, just a very clean room, friendly staff and a great experience all round!!! Mustafa and the crew are great, they are all very friendly. They all speak English and are very helpful in every situation. The hotel is located in a lovely part of the Latin quarter and with it's close proximity to the beautiful Luxembourg gardens, is an easy choice in our eyes. The room we stayed in was clean, big enough for the two of us as it is Europe. The bathroom was amazing with a shower over bath, good view from our openable window and a large flat panel tv screen. No problems with any works as all the refurbs had been completed by the time we arrived, and it all looks amazing. Highly recommend for any occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne V
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was lovely. The location was superb. The hotel's proximity to train and bus stops was very convenient, and it was nice to be able to go to the gardens and walk or run; yet, it was far enough away from the noise of crowded, busy places. The room was a nice size and well-appointed, although the bathroom was just a bit small. The entire hotel is non-smoking. There is a restaurant attached to, although not owned by, the hotel, and it was quite nice, as was the breakfast buffet that was served (available during convenient hours for optional purchase). Our favorite part of the hotel, though, was the staff at the front desk, which was extremely helpful, friendly, and well-versed in English (thank goodness for us). We were especially grateful for the kindness and service of Moustafa, who oriented us to the hotel, stored one of our large suitcases that we didn't need during our stay, went out of his way to help us with every question we had, helped us find our way around the city, gave us tips on shopping, and arranged our transportation to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stickeler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. Small but comfortable room with air conditioning. Great Staff who were very helpful. Good location to Lux. Gardens across the street. Bus stop in front to Major attractions. Breakfast was very European and good. Husbands wallet was pickpocked on RER and the police were extremely helpful as well as the hotel staff. Nicely priced for Paris. Walking distance to great restaurants. Close to the Sorbonne.

Reviews.Title: “Great reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: ASStockholm
Reviews.Content: Stayed two days on business and I think this is the best so far. Small recently refurbished boutique hotel with small but stylish comfortable rooms and great welcome. Will definitely return next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and service”
Reviews.Author: Travis H
Reviews.Content: We arrived two nights late due to serious issues with our plane. They only charged us for one of the two nights we missed. The room was clean and nice, the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel location :very good”
Reviews.Author: ciprianjitaru_jitaru
Reviews.Content: Clean, nice hotel. Small rooms , but this is normal in Paris. Right near RER station with direct link (RER B ) to CGD Airport. Rooms facing the St Michel boulevard are noisy due to the trafic. Breakfast is rather poor regarding the choiches but good. By foot around 10 -15 minutes to Notre Dame. Air conditioning sistem working well. Personel and services are ok.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous value and customer service!”
Reviews.Author: vegnycparlon
Reviews.Content: Our friends arrived in Paris a week before we did and they told us Moustafa would take care of us upon our arrival. They were right - Moustafa was there to welcome us to Paris and was always helpful during our stay. Being a small hotel, the service was more personal. If you needed something, the front desk happily provided it right away. Our room was small as expected but very nice with two windows to give us views to two different streets. The hotel has been renovated and is clean and modern. We were on the 3rd floor so we could take the elevator or stairs. We enjoyed hanging out in the lobby chatting with our friends and watching people come and go. The location is great for taking the train from the airport. The Luxembourg stop is right by the hotel on the RER B. The only drawback of the location is you have to take the RER to another location to connect to the Metro but that's not a problem when you have an unlimited metro pass. We had a great rate on our room and plan to stay there again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is excellent - not less than that”
Reviews.Author: Eli A
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very professional, friendly, and like to help in any issue at any time of the day and the night. The hotel rooms are new, maintenance is very good, the bed was very comfortable. The location of the hotel is perfect, in the centre but still far from the noise of the center. We would like to recommend this hotel when your are staying in Paris as a family and as a pair.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Brad S
Reviews.Content: Charming Botique Hotel. Great location, easy train ride from the airport. Close walk to Nortre Dame, Seine and across from Jardine Du Luxembourg. Moustafa, Nicolas and Valentine are wonderful, helpful and very friendly! I think Moustafa alone is worth the stay here. Rooms are nice, and very clean. Beds and pillows very comfortable. We would absolutely choose the Hotel Observatoire Luxembourg for our next visit to Paris. Tip: Buy Metro tickets and Museum passes at the airport before coming into Paris. Learn the bus system before you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “We love the hotel and we hope to return”
Reviews.Author: T S
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel, we hope to return and we have recommended you to our friends and family. The service at the desk was friendly and efficient. The hotel, including the en suite bath room, was pristine clean; everything was as brand new. The hotel is next to the famous Luxembourg gardens, 1 minute from the metro and 15 minutes walk to Notre Dame. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Wow, will never stay anywhere else in Paris agani”
Reviews.Author: Buxtontravel
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous place. Great staff, wonderful rooms, amazing bathroom, exceptional value for money in a VERY expensive city. I won't bother staying anywhere else in Paris again; this place is a ten minute stroll down to the river and handy for everything. Fab. The only thing that would improve it for me is china cups for the tea and coffee making facilities instead of paper. And the coffee we had in the adjacent bistro was undrinkable. They are VERY minor points (that I'm just adding so that next time I go it's even more wonderful) and all I could find fault in in a four night stay.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend. Great chocie in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Luciana S
Reviews.Content: Nice room, nice staff, wonderful breakfast and location couldn't be better. Thank for the attention we had during our stay. Stephanie & Marjorie Samaha

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kirkrgaucho
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Observatoire. We liked everything about it. Location was perfect, great neighborhood, at the foot of the Pantheon, across street from Luxembourg gardens and right next to the RER station, which made it easy to get around town and to and from the airport. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. Elie, in particular was a gem. She was very welcoming and always gave us perfect directions. The entire staff made us feel at home even though we were in a foreign place. Our room was comfortable, quiet and air conditioning worked perfectly. The room wasn't big by any means, but we expected that and it was big enough. Breakfast was simple and provided a seamless start to each day. There are some nice creperies and cafes in the area that provided additional breakfast options. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Chic”
Reviews.Author: b_1007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our first wedding anniversary. The location is fantastic, the RER train from the CDG airport stops literally outside the hotel entrance. We got to the hotel early as we had taken the first flight out of the UK, surprisingly our room was ready for us. From the lobby right through to the rooms the decor was chic and contemporary. I found the style full of character and individual, a far cry from the bland uniformity often found in the chain hotels. The room size was on the small side, but then that was to be expected in the middle of a buzzing city where space would be premium. despite the small size, the room had everything for a comfortable stay and modern fittings. We had been given a room that fell to the back, which is a bonus as you don't get the sounds from the busy road there. The hotel entrance faces the Luxembourg Gardenswhich are beautiful and has a brasserie next to it where the hotel patrons can have breakfast. Although our package included breakfast, we preffered to experience the different cafes and bistros and so can't comment on the breakfast, however, we did stop there for lunch and enjoyed the meal and service offered. Being located in the heart of the Latin Quarter, there is no shortage of eateries. While I touch on location, the hotel is a 15-20min walk from the Notre Dame, along the way there are lots of brasseries and cafes. There is a direct bus to the Louvre and the Eiffel Tower from across the road, and as already mentioned there is a RER stop right outside the door. I have saved the best for last, the staff-AMAZING!!! From check-in to check-out the service and attention was faultless. The reception is manned 24-hours and due to the hotel being on the smaller side, there is the intimacy of getting to the know the staff. There was nothing that was too much, always eager to offer help. Asked about our day everytime they saw us, offered advice and were happy to chat whist maintaining efficiency and professionalism. We have stumbled upon a gem and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best treatment have received in my all trips”
Reviews.Author: paulo_rocco
Reviews.Content: In The Hotel Observatoire Luxembourg we were treated very very well as never were in hotels during our trips in special by Mr.Moustafa

Reviews.Title: “A good one”
Reviews.Author: Ksenjushka
Reviews.Content: Well, my husband and I were staying in this hotel, which is situated just a few steps from RER Luxembourg and apposite Luxembourg park. The service was really fantastic, the receptionists did all their best to make our vacation unforgettable. The room was cosy, but while we were there, they were repairing the hall, so lobby was in mess, but that' s the only "-"! And actually this RER line goes straight from/to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Christi1101
Reviews.Content: Some renovation going on at time of stay, but no problem for us. Unbelievably helpful, English speaking gentleman named Nicholas at front desk. So great with recommendations, directions, and evening holding bags for us during quick trip to Normandy region when other hotel we were returning to was nasty about it. Rooms decent size, clean, A/C and elevator! Can't say enough about how much we appreciated Nicholas and our stay here on my first time to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Value to money”
Reviews.Author: Marioncami
Reviews.Content: Observatoire Luxembourge did justice to the price we paid. I won’t hesitate to call it a recommended accommodation in Paris. The hotel would be attached to our memories always because we were first timers in Paris and luckily stayed there. Our tour was special for being my first planned outing with my husband after marriage. However only one year has passed since we got married but the first tour mattered a lot to us. Observatoire is surrounded by nicer views that we could enjoy from our room only. The attached bathroom could be expected to be a little more spacious yet certainly not a problem. We witnessed well cared luxuries backed perfectly by friendly keepers.

Reviews.Title: “très agreable”
Reviews.Author: mollica62
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The bedroom was small, but that's the standard in Paris, so no surprise, and with one of the best bed I have ever found in an hotel: soft but not too much, luxurious lining, warm to to right point. I had a room on the top floor and with the window shut not problem with the noise of the boulevard. The bathroom was completely renovated and nice: just one minus, the space left for your own toilet affairs is all taken by the hotel complimentary supplies!! and there are no hangers. The stairs case was under renovations the day I was there. Personnel at the reception was friendly, while the ladies attending the breakfast were not that much, especially the one behind the counter. The breakfast is correct, but in such a small corner that you are asked to share a tiny little table with a perfect stranger. Which is pretty strange as the rest of the room is shared with a café and they have all the space - almost empty! Ah! Free wi-fi available and working with no problems!

Reviews.Title: “All I wanted from Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadyKiev
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Paris was a decade ago.Since that time, I found some places in this city I like best of all.I value good location, good access, cleanliness etc., everything a tourist wants to obtain in a trip! This hotel is situated just near Boulevard de Saint Michel.For me and my 16-year old daughter it was a lovely place to stay because we made a long walks throuhg the boulevards, minutes from Louvre and other places of interest. Ww were shooting a lot, especially everyday life, people, houses. I would like to specially thank all hotel stuff for their attention, help, assistance every day.They really care, and do their best.Next time will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path, but close to everything”
Reviews.Author: aja9p9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Paris in December for leisure and we are so glad that we went with this hotel. We liked it because it was really easy to get to (less than a block from the RER Luxemourg stop), had relatively good sized rooms and bathroom for Europe and for not spending $$$$, and the staff were really helpful. It's an independent hotel so it doesn't have a lot of bells and whistles and the place isn't big, but if I go abroad I kind of don't want to feel like I am in the same Hyatt/Hilton/Whatever hotel I would be in if I visited Omaha, NE, you know? I didn't felt like I was in Europe there. Plus, if you walk out the door there is a little market three doors to the left - for any quick snacks, things you forgot to bring, or a little champagne, wine, or beer, whatever suits your mood. :) And there was this restaurant around the corner from the hotel that the guy desk recommended and it was AMAZING. The restaurant is called Las Papilles and it's one of those places that only serves one 3 or 4 course menu each night, but it was so good! The place is small and adorable. Even if you don't stay at the hotel, but find yourself in the Latin Quarter or near the Jardin Luxembourg, then I'd definitely say the restaurant was worth stopping in.

Reviews.Title: “A Noisy Mess”
Reviews.Author: vegaslamb
Reviews.Content: Expedia did not tell me this place was in the middle of a very poorly planned and unfortunate looking renovation. The room was so hot that we tried to sleep with the windows open. He told us it was not time to turn on air conditioning yet. It was SO noisy ALL night, that we couldn't even sleep. This hotel was $300 a night, by the way so not even cheap enough to make it understandable. The elevator didn't work, so we had to carry bags up five flights through construction debris. Two gentlemen at the front desk were very nice and helpful, though one was quite rude. I'm sure there are others who had better experiences, but this was mine. We checked out after one night and moved to a better hotel down the street on a quiet side street because I do love the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for purpose”
Reviews.Author: OuterHebridean
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the 5th floor after it has been newly renovated. Strong smell of paint (really strong!) which will only fade, but room really nice, comfy very large bed, excellent shower and free wifi which is SO handy for checking stuff you are going to/booking stuff, etc.. I heard a couple couple complain about the room( i imaging about smell) the dude seemed more than happy to do what he could but dont know the out come. Friendly staff ad clean rooms. I would come back here, as it is very handy for metro from Airports. So glad to come out of the Luxembourg stop after a long day travelling with a hangover and see the hotel straight ahead! Only down side is paint smell and not sure if Air Con was working.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE---Stay in the center of a Construction Site-No extra charge!”
Reviews.Author: screenameTallahassee
Reviews.Content: Yes,the front desk guy is nice; probably because he has dealt with so many irate unsuspecting customers who arrive at the hotel after viewing the hotel illusion (website) only to realize that they have fallen into an episode of, "This Old House." The front lobby looks like a storage closet, messy and uninviting. This is just a precursor ro the rest of the hotel public spaces. Arriving on the fifth floor, the tiny clangy lift opens to the view of exposed wiring dangling dowm like serpents. scuffed walls, dusty sills, paint cans, and construction related debris. Not that the hotel does not have some redeeming qualities-good view and location-those qualities are overshadowed by rip off of false advertising. Like saying,"Other than that Mrs. Lincoln, how was the play?"

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Gembem
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was undergoing renovations during our stay our room was perfect and we didn't hear a thing from our 5th floor room. However, the lift was out of order for some of our stay which could be a problem for people with disabilities. RER metro station right outside the door and easy stroll to Seine and Notre Dame and Louvre. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: samy0
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel as a surprise for my birthday. We were very pleased with the room. It looked as if it had recently been renovated. The hotel is undergoing construction so there were holes in the walls in the hallways and construction materials strewn about. However, that did not affect us or our lovely room. The bed was really comfortable. The location is fabulous. The Pantheon is just around the corner and Notre Dame is not a far walk either. There is a metro stop right outside the hotel and numerous cafe's and restuarants nearby. The hotel staff, particularly the day staff was fantastic. We parked in a no parking zone (we didn't know) and our car was towed. The staff called the police station, printed us out maps and helped guide us to find our car. They also provided us with free champagne for my birthday. We would definitely stay there again and would love to see all the new renovations completed!

Reviews.Title: “NOTE: Being refurbished as of 6th Feb 2011”
Reviews.Author: Moos3h
Reviews.Content: First thing's first: The hotel is being refurbished as I write this and many areas as a result are very scruffy, paint-splattered and reek of fresh (gloss) paint. Next important point? The staff were EXCEPTIONAL. We decided that we were unable to stay due to the refurbishment and voiced our concerns to the gentleman manning the front desk. He could not have been more helpful and accommodating and we were genuinely impressed with what he was able to organize for us - he is truly a credit to his profession and front-of-house in general. Exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, welcoming and genuine and wonderfully located”
Reviews.Author: Treggles
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly, welcoming and genuine. Moustafa greeted us each day with kindness and genuine interest in our stay. The night staff could learn a lot from him! The Hotel is in a wonderful location - access to transport, gardens, sights and so on. A perfect location for a wonderful break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel with Charming Staff Too”
Reviews.Author: runninghistory
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful weeklong stay at this charming, clean boutique hotel which is right next to the Luxembourg gardens -- convenient for jogging. The rooms are slightly larger than your typical Paris hotel room (although beware Americans, they are small based on American standards). The bathroom was much better than many those in other Paris hotels -- up to date hardware, new grout, extremely clean and relatively roomy. The elevator also was fairly modern. The location of this hotel is convenient -- right on Blvd San Michel, near cafes and a grocery store. Since the hotel fronts a fairly busy street, you have to expect some traffic noise if you have a room that looks out over the Blvd, but I did not find it to be a problem sleeping. What really distinguished this hotel for me and made my stay memorable was the kind and welcoming front desk staff -- Mustafa and the weekend staff person on Nov 20-21, in particular. They always had a cheery good morning ready and were helpful in making reservations and suggestions for restaurants etc. My only disappointment was the exhorbitant charge to use the computer in the lobby -- 10 euros an hour. While they do have free wireless, not all of us travel with our laptops.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine”
Reviews.Author: jaimee1968
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HOL in Sept for our trip to Paris. I personally would have preferred something more upscale with more amenties but everything that met my criteria was way out of our price range, ridiculous, like $600 a night, thus a settled for expesnive dinners and less expensive lodging (good choice considering how little we were in our room). HOL provided us convenient safe, and clean accommodations. The location was great and we had a larger room, especially for Paris standards. I had a problem with the electric plugs - my converter wouldn't fit and so my blow dryer and flat iron wouldn't work which caused me much angst. (this is important to me I'm a girl- as I explained to my husband). Nicoli our front desk representative was extremly helpful and offered us info from places to go to transportation tips. If our budget is the same next time we return to Paris we'd absolutely consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “mixed. tiny, noisy room but good location”
Reviews.Author: hy4esf
Reviews.Content: booked on last minute - approx £100/night. (???appeared cheap for paris) website looks amazing. our experience not so. on tiniest 5th floor room, no pictures, decked out in brown. small bed with limp pillows. on one of paris's busiest streets - plus=good location, negative=noisy. room had air con which didnt work so window had to be open at night. complained about aircon and they told us it was fixed, but it never did get sorted. breakfast offered at 13euros each. no tea/coffee in room - big negative. location is a big bonus and hotel staff were relatively helpful. mixed opinion

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: FongGa
Reviews.Content: We had one of the Deluxe Rooms which came with tea and coffee making facilities. The room was comfortable but not spacious. Comfortable bed and good bathroom. We had a room facing the main road but noise was not a problem. Reception staff were pleasant and cheerful. The hotel is well situated for the train line and a short five minute walk to the Metro. Free wifi. Take care when checking out as they try to charge your credit card in your home currency, which is done at a significant mark up. We had an enjoyable stay in the hotel and would consider staying here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Don,t believe photos on websites!”
Reviews.Author: Emjayarkley
Reviews.Content: Silly me. We booked this hotel for three nights after looking at their website and the lovely rooms in the photos..How disappointed we were when we opened the door and found a very ordinary room, not a bit like the photos and what we expected. We asked to be moved and were told that the hotel was full and they told us that only a few rooms were photographed for the website, in other words it was just pot luck. We had booked with the hotel about three months before and probably had the worst room. We had been travelling around the UK and France for six weeks and up to this point out accomodations had been beautiful with no problems. As this was to be our last stop before returning to Australia we wanted our stay in Paris to be special but special it was not. Be warned : You can,t always trust what you see on a hotels' website. This hotel certainly did not meet the standard we were looking for and received elsewhere. Emjay Sydney Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest Hotel Ever and Perfect Paris Location”
Reviews.Author: AmyRhinehartBailey
Reviews.Content: The depth of the cleaning after our first night impressed me right away and the service at breakfast was sublime as were the croissants, but the front desk was what would make me want to always stay here when we come to Paris. The three wonderful front desk people all knew every train number and station location as well as bus routes and best times to go to each attraction. As well as English and French, I also heard them speak German and Spanish. They drew me maps every day we left the room and everywhere they sent us to eat Loved Americans and was reasonably priced and the food was out of this world delicious.

Reviews.Title: “no views of Luxembourg gardens but still charming”
Reviews.Author: explore_&_indulge
Reviews.Content: At the time we booked the website claimed views of Luxembourg gardens, which altho very close ( a half block to entrance) is difficult to believe. However, the hotel is charming and rooms at the back do have pleasant views of another garden, and are quieter away from the main road. The reception staff are wonderful, very helpful with directions, bookings for a show and any other help you may want. As it was wet weather for our visit the use of complimentary umbrellas was very welcome. The rooms are clean and tastefully decorated - with an old world charm factor. The RER station to the airport is just a hundred or so metres away (but no lifts - you will have a few stairs to climb with your luggage). From the hotel it is an easy, pleasant walk to NotreDame, Musee D'orsay, Louvre and the Latin quarter - all in a 20 min or so radius from the hotel. So location is good if you want the visit these sights. And the Luxembourg Gardens are worth a wander.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful escape from normality”
Reviews.Author: Rosaleen_10
Reviews.Content: We had 7 wonderful days in this hotel and they never let us down, of course neither did Paris!. Rooms had fresh bedding every day were well cleaned. The reception staff were able to answer all our queries wth great willingness and pleasantness at all times One very slight criticism could they vary the hot dish breakfast Scrambled eggs for 7 days was a bit much!!! A brilliant spot for public transport

Reviews.Title: “Perfect locaiton, great staff”
Reviews.Author: BANDLSydney
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 3 nights during a recent trip to Paris, and were very pleased and relieved to find that all the previous good comments we'd read were accurate. Yes, the rooms are somewhat small in comparison to others, but more importantly they are very clean, quiet, and comfortable. Rooms at the back of the hotel overlook a small private garden, and the Jardins de Luxembourg across the road are just stunnning. The location is perfect - close to transport, and some fabulous restaurants in Saint Michel. Even more impressive though were the staff - they were exceptionally friendly and helpful. When we discovered at the last minute that we need a visa for an ensuing trip to China, they went out of their way to assist with phone calls, emails and faxes, all at no extra charge. All in all, we would highly recommend this hotel for its good value and excellent staff - we'd certainly stay again next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with wonderful staff, excellant location that I would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: bartlett47
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days. The location was great, near the Luxembourg gardens, which were a delight to see. Its a good walk to Paris , but a bus or a taxi or a train were all easily gotten. We chose to walk every where. The Musee D'Orsay, Notre Dame Saint Germaine The river Seine all were easily gotten to.The hotel staff were absolutely lovely and very helpful. Nights were quiet, the room although small, was perfect for us. We needed nothing and if we did the hotel staff helped us or showed us where we could attain it. I was sick on a couple of the days and the staff were really helpful. Extra pillows more towels nothing was too much trouble. I am going back

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere to stay in Paris for a resaonable price”
Reviews.Author: TravelFrog42
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Observatoire Luxembourg didn't get off to a good start as our booked deluxe room wasn't available for another 24 hours (!), however a standard room was made available for the first night and the apologetic staff gave us free champagne and breakfast (first day only) for the inconvenience. Friendly staff and location are the best features of this small hotel. The rooms are plainly fitted and are small to average in size for Paris (from my previous experiences of Paris hotels anyway) with an average sized bathroom. Beyond the modest foyer, the hallways and rooms are showing their age and could use some maintenance work. The small elevator was a boon when arriving and departing with luggage. The view from our 1st level room was of the private gardens at the rear of the hotel as well as a small street. Double-glazing kept the room quiet with the windows closed but the inefficient air conditioning (could only heat) forced us to open the windows during warmer nights and put up with the street noise. Upon check out, we were charged for a deluxe room for the first night despite being given a standard room, which we quickly corrected. Overall, the pleasant staff and the very convenient location (Luxembourg Gardens are ideal for morning/evening strolls) made our stay better than it could have been.

Reviews.Title: “the staff made a dream trip a dream come true”
Reviews.Author: parissister
Reviews.Content: my sister and I stayed at hotel observatoire to celebrate my 50th birthday. We were greeted by the most gracious and friendly staff upon arrival. Moustaffa, Nicolas and the female staff member whose name i unfortunately have forgotten, could not do enough for us. From recommending the best way to get around, sights not to be missed, confirming tours & travel arrangements and helping out when my sister was extremely ill quite suddenly, providing extra pillows, ice, cold water, medical info, they were a blessing to us. Nothing was ever done without a huge smile and the feeling that it was no trouble at all. The hotel has an elevator, not that common i believe, which is a godsend at the end of a full day on your feet. The hotel room itself was excellent. Very clean and comfortable, made up and cleaned each day. The bathroom was lovely and clean with toiletries. We requested a room at the back away from the main road to avoid night time noise and were greeted with a beautiflu outlook, hard not to get when in Paris. Overall a wonderful, warm, experience which we will hopefully enjoy again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing staff..felling home away from home”
Reviews.Author: abijaudi
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank all staff, specially NICOLAS (front desk) for excellent service, care and specialy information. I go to Paris usually twice an year for a month and I found my home away from home! Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary in ALL ways! Hotel Observatoire Luxembourg”
Reviews.Author: swanship
Reviews.Content: My adult son and I stayed in this hotel in the Latin Quarter of Paris 7 nights with my adult daughter joining us for one of the nights. Absolutely fantastic was the service! We had 3 primary desk managers and each was outstanding! We needed extra help: tracking down lost luggage, storing luggage while we took a side trip, calliing cabs, figuring the best travel plan to Provence, directing us to places, recommending places, answering many, many questions! They were kind, personable, expert, knowledgable...everything we could as for and more. The rooms are gorgeous and so, so clean. The daily service is impeccable, and the rooms couldn't be cleaner or more comfortable! The location is also fantastic. We took an RER from Charles de Gaulle Airport, and the stop was less than a block from our hotel. The Brasserie attached to the hotel is also very nice and reasonable priced. We will be returning to stay again in two weeks, and I will always visit and recommend this hotel when I'm in Paris! Debra Schipper

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: treetops09
Reviews.Content: Fantastic small hotel. Friendly staff. Room spacious, especially for Paris. Location was great. Metro opposite hotel. Plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. Would definitely stay again when visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location from which to explore. Clean, good value and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LinThom
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Hotel Observatoire Luxembourg. The discounted rooms available from the hotel's website are great value. The hotel is at the top end of its 3 star rating. Perfectly clean, comfortable and very practical in terms of a location, being within a 15 minute walk of Notre Dame and 50m from the Luxembourg RER stop. Although hotels in Paris are not known for breakfasts I ate the breakfast here each morning. €13 extra - a buffet including tea/coffee/fruit juice, croissants, baguette, jams, cheese, ham, fruit, yoghurts and cereal. Would definitely recommend it as a base for a (non extortionate) trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “This is a conveniently located hotel with friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Retireejonesflynn
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this charming old hotel ... close to the Metro ... it has both an elevator and air conditioning (not commonly available in Paris) ... pleasant views overlooking gardens ... comfortable bed ... a small room, but very clean and a good bathroom with tub and shower. Recommended. AA++

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mutumbo
Reviews.Content: The location is great. It is right in front of the Luxembourg Garden in Paris 5th. It is also only 50 meters from the RER station line B which connects you to CDG and Orly. We loved walking in the park after our morning cafe creme and croissant at Dalloyau (our favorite patisserie in Paris). The superior rooms are a little small, however, deluxe rooms are roomy enough. The rooms on the back overlook a beautiful private garden and are quiet. The staff is very friendly. We did not opt for the b&b deal but they do serve breakfast, as well as having a brasserie. There is also free WIFI. We will surely stay here, when and if we are in Paris next.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: kate_potts
Reviews.Content: I have just spent four nights in the hotel observatoire luxembourg and really I cannot fault the place. Rooms are clean and have very good air conditioning, it was more spacious than I imagined after hearing paris hotel rooms are really small. The bathroom was fine too and clean, it had a shower over a bath, so there was plenty of room in there. The reception staff are great, spoke brilliant english and were always helpful with giving directions, transport etc. Its in a really good location near the latin quarter and saint germain. Its about 10-15 minutes walk from the patheon and about 20 to notre dame. Its also right next to the Luxembourg rer station. Easy to get to from CDG you get on RER B to Luxembourg, when you get off the RER there are to exits, take the south exit, its the one nearest the front of the train and as you come up the step straight ahead you will see a brasserie called Le Luco's, the hotel is right next door to that. Just 1 extra tip, if you are looking for a nice meal away from the latin quarter we found alot of nice restaurants on the street St Louis en L'ile, near notre dame.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: drinkie007
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. I've stayed at many more expensive hotels in Paris in the past but have never received such consistently excellent service. The receptionist spoke perfect English and could not have been more helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable and contained everything we needed (air conditioning, fridge, safe, etc). Having read other reviews we did email the hotel in advance to request a room at the back of the hotel, overlooking the gardens, and that was excellent advice. The location is also really good. There is an RER station right outside the front of the hotel, just 3 stops from the Gard du Nord and 1 stop from Place St Michel. It's directly opposite the Jardin Luxembourg, and just a 10 minute walk to the end of Boulevard St Michel where the little pedestrianised 'hub' of the Latin Quarter restaurants/bars can be found, just opposite Notre Dame. We could not fault this hotel in terms of service, facilities or location - and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good clean hotel with friendly staff and good communication”
Reviews.Author: Mindtrust
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 night and it was so easy to get there from CDG, we just went with the RER and went up the south exit and saw the hotel right away. It's just next to Luxembourg Park which is a very nice area to stroll around in when you get tired of the city life. The hotel itself i just on the edge of the main tourist area, so it's not noicy at all but ask for a room facing the backyard since you will have a nice view over a very big private garde with a nice fountain. It's just a 5min walk from the Pantheon and maybe 10 minutes to Notre Dame ? Like mentioned earlier the RER station is just outside for good communication. If you walk up north a little bit just around Pantheon and the north exit of the RER Luxembourg you will find many good busses going to Eiffel and other places if you don't want to use the metro station. About the rooms, everyone said the rooms are small in central Paris and this one was also quite small, but it was totally ok. The room had a safebox a little closet and some drawers to put away things. The AC worked fine and the minibar and tv was totally ok. The bathroom had very nice items for showering and etc. Overall this was a very good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, with excellent front-desk service”
Reviews.Author: AFlyingShip
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located. From CDG airport, we sent about 40 minutes on the RER (train), directly to the hotel. Therefore, no stress with carrying our luggage or arriving there. The front-desk staff were very friendly, and displayed excellent customer service. They gave recommendations regarding places to go, eat, etc. Although your own mileage may vary, I found the attached restaurant/cafe to be a letdown when I had breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: TAMember1234
Reviews.Content: My husband has stayed here many times on business. I recently joined him there and was very impressed. Having arrived three nights before me, my husband had been obliged to cancel his room for the second night of his stay, as he had to spend a night away from Paris. When he returned the next day, there had been some confusion, and the rest of his stay there had been cancelled ! The hotel was full for that night, and it was approaching midnight, but the receptionist managed to find a room in another hotel, payed for by the Observatoire, as was the taxi to take my husband there. I arrived the next day, and we were very surprised that evening to find a half bottle of champagne delivered to our room to apologise for the mix up. `The staff are all very pleasant, the continental breakfast buffet is fine, and the hotel is ideally situated ---- opposite the Luxembourg Gardens and only 50 metres from the metro line to Charles de Gaulle airport. The rooms are typical of a city centre hotel, not huge but more than adequate. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: hwkrasner
Reviews.Content: After researching hotels on tripadvisor for a trip which included 3 moms and 4 teenage daughters we selected this boutique hotel based on prior positive reviews and the hotels willingness to provide a triple room. The hotel did not dissappoint and even exceeded our expectations. The bed was very comfortable, the shower was hot and inviting, and the room was spotlessly clean. The location was perfect, just steps from the Metro. The ample breakfast which included cheeses, yogurt, cereal, eggs, meat, fruit, and of course croissants and delicious coffee was a great way to start each day of site-seeing and shopping. We followed prior recommendations of requesting a room facing the gardens behind the hotel and found this useful for enjoying the view and avoiding street noise in the wee hours. The staff was helpful and patient with our many questions, mostly in English, as our French is spotty at best. Currency converters were not necessary for cell phone chargers.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: hb277
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of nights when we arrived in France. It was a great way to start our vacation. The room was clean with a great view overlooking some gardens (not the Luxembourg gardens), the staff were very friendly and the buffet breakfast was good. The location is perfect: quiet but just a short walk to where everything is happening in the Latin Quarter and St Germaine. And of course it is just across the road from the Luxembourg Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: bbb3
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at this hotel for our anniversary. Enjoyed our stay very much. Good location (only about a block from the Metro Station) right on St Michel (one stop away from Notre Dame). Front desk staff very friendly and helpful. Room was a good size (much bigger than what I expected for Paris) and clean. We slept with our windows open every night (5th floor, so street noise not too bad). We would stay here again if we ever get back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The ideal home base for a visit to Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Lynne067
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated in the Latin Quarter, with the Jardin du Luxembourg across the street and shops and public transportation (RER, buses) a few steps away. Lodgings, though small, were clean, safe and comfortable; meals in the hotel's breakfast room and adjacent bistro were excellent; and service by the hotel's desk staff was outstanding. I will be recommending the Hotel Observatoire Luxembourg to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Hotel Observatoire was wonderful in every single way.”
Reviews.Author: Jan747
Reviews.Content: This hotel has absolutely everything that we look for in a hotel. It is very clean. The location simply cannot be beat (it is across the street from the Luxemburg Gardens), and access to all public transit is nearby. The room rate was reasonable. The restaurant next door is great and should not be missed, the hotel breakfast has a lot of variety, and the size of the rooms is adequate. Best of all, the Hotel Observatoire has terrific staff, and the importance of this cannot be overstated in the opinion of my husband, our two sisters, and myself. The staff is totally professional, friendly, and responsive to every request. We stayed for over a week and were totally satisfied. We will stay at this hotel again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further!”
Reviews.Author: GlenEckett
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel the Hotel Observatoire Luxembourg was! Went to Paris for the first time for a long weekend, and will certainly have no hesitation in booking into this hotel again. The hotel can't be missed really, immediately infront of you as you come out of Luxembourg Metro station, three stops away from Gare du Nord Eurostar station. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the room was very fresh and clean. I read in another review to ask for a room facing the back of the hotel, and this is a great suggestion. The front faces onto Boulevard St Michel which is fairly busy during the day, but the back of the hotel looks out over a lovely private garden for some kind of stately home - a great view and very little noise! Big double windows which can be opened to take it all in :) Finally, from the hotel we could walk to the Seine in about 15 minutes, and even less to the stunning Jardin du Luxebourg - a large public garden with fountains etc which is great for sitting back and watching Parisian life pass by! Overall, I was really happy with this hotel, and certainly won't feel the need to look elsewhere when we choose to come back to this incredible city!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a lovely area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Odd_Eyes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights for our 1st wedding anniversary. I am so glad I chose this hotel. We booked the double superior room and while small, we were not disappointed. We had a lovely view across to a garden and fountain. The room itself had enough storage for our clothes, handy fridge and lovely bathroom with shower and bath (which you could lie in and look at the view!). The bed was a proper double bed (not two singles put together) and was so comfortable that I slept like a baby. The road noise wasn't bad, although we were on the quieter side of the hotel. If it did get noisy, the double glazing was brilliant and just put on the air con. The staff are so friendly and obliging and patient with my pigeon French! There is a really nice Brasserie downstairs which we ate breakfast and dinner at one of the days and thoroughly enjoyed the food and service great. The second reason to come to this hotel is it's location. We got a train direct from CDG airport and literally arrived at the hotel entrance - so easy! It is also located across from the stunningly beautiful Jardin de Luxembourg - beautiful gardens to go for a walk or just sit and watch the world go by (with a coffee and a crepe!). We also watched the local Parisian men play chess and boules in the gardens - we could have hung out there for the full 3 days quite happily. We tended to walk everywhere - Pantheon is only 5-10 mins walk and the Louvre and Notre Dame down by the river are maybe 30 min walk if that. En route, the sights and and sounds of Paris just engulf you and it is easy to soak up the atmosphere of this beautiful city. If you do not wish to / cannot walk, the trains and buses are located right outside for easy access. I would not hesitate to book this hotel again if (when) we return in the future. Many thanks x

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with great staff...with two gliches”
Reviews.Author: mbrnewjersey
Reviews.Content: First, I agree with almost all the wonderful reviews. The room was comfortable. The bath was just lovely. Full tub and stand-up shower; counter for your toiletries; plenty of space in general. The small room was comfortable and the staff rolled in a surprisingly comfortable rollaway bed for me, as my two girls took the (very large) bed in the room. Flat screen TV with both CNN and BBC as well as all the usual French and German channels. One of the front desk managers was particularly nice and extraordinarily helpful. He suggested outings and told us when it was better to take the bus than the Metro/RER. Every time he looked up something for us he made it seem like it was no trouble at all. I'm sorry I didn't get his name but he was a reason we would return to this hotel in the future. Here are the two gliches. !. I ased for a wake up call for the morning we were leaving. I saw the front desk person write it down, but I asked twice if he were sure I would get the call, so I could sleep. He assured me I would. I did not. So we rushed out of the hotel and I had to travel without even being able to take a shower before we left. 2. My daughters got stuck in the elevator one morning. The cab apparently was caught between the ground floor and the first floor. Eventually, the right technical person was dispatched, he got the doors opened and he reached in and lifted out each of my daughters. There was no harm done, but I thought the staff was a bit cavalier about two kids being stuck in an elevator. All in all, a great stay...but I would take the stairs whenever I could! And bring your own alarm clock.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Affus
Reviews.Content: Perfect location close to the Latin Quarters, right opposite the park Luxembourg. RER entrence just outside hotel with direct connection with CDG airport. Very helpful staff. Small but nice rooms. Rooms on the backside are quiet an have a nice view on a large garden across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel in a fantastic location next to the park.”
Reviews.Author: MrMaikranz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. I loved the location and it is very close (like less than 100 meters) from the Metro & RER. The rooms were a little small for two people (as many are in European city center hotels), but very clean and fully functional.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, fairly priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Londoner88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really good standard hotel. It was constantly clean, are bed was made everyday, and bathroom thoroughly cleaned with fresh towels provided. The room was small but then this is Paris and it certainly wasn't a shoebox. The service in the hotel was excellent, really helpful really charming. I loved being a stones throw from the Luxembourg gardens and the RER is 30 seconds from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: giterman
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on reviews from trip advisor and found most of them accurate. For the person who left without unpacking their suitcase I cant remotely see why. Firstly this was our 1st trip to Paris and travelled with Eurostar, which in its self fantasic so worried about finding the hotel. Arrived Gard De Nord and took Metro to Luxembourg. As hotel was 107 St Michel when coming off Metro you have the choice of 69 or 99. Go to 99 and as soon as you come up the steps the the Hotel is straight in front of you. Check in was quick and friendly and concierge extremely helpful in what to do, see eat etc. Room was small, not extremely, but clean with good views of the area. The rooms were cleaned daily and no qualms wwhatsoever with the room. Also good stock of toiletries in the Bathroom although the shower was small. The area is quiet and safe and yards from Luxembourg Gdns, and 15 minute walk possibly quicker for younger persons to Notre Damme abd 5 mintes walk from the university of Sorbonne. If walkinf recommend turn right down St Michel as nothing much to the left. One regret is that we didnt take the breakfast in the hotel as we thought it might be cheaper looking elsewhere but the hotels seem as cheap as anywhere else. 2 small negatives but these were far outweighed by the positives. 1 is that there must be a line directly beneath the hotel and at certain times can hear the underground, and secondly you are not trusted with the key and must hand it in everytime you leave the building but the concierge on every occasion was extremely courteous. On the final day they kept our case for 5 hours after check out which was another plus. All in all would certainly go back and the location and accessibility to all of Paris hot spots makes it a desirable place to stay. Finally on the last

Reviews.Title: “Excellent warm, friendly, clean Hotel ....”
Reviews.Author: barker_man
Reviews.Content: We are now back from our short break to the hotel. The hotel was suberb, lovely and clean, and the room we stayed in was fabulous, with views of the tree lined streets and lovely and warm. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. Ian Barker

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay Near Luxemborg Gardens”
Reviews.Author: NowAndThenTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in late October and again in mid-November 2009. Note: Hotel rates drop in Paris November 1 and seem to drop again after November 15. The weather, while overcast (when is Paris not overcast?), was cool, but reasonable. And no crowds anywhere except the Louvre. So if you can choose your travel time and are on a tight budget, consider coming in November. One drawback of a November visit. though, is the sun sets about 5:00 p.m. When, jet lagged, we first saw our room, my heart sunk. It had the pleasant view I'd requested (of a garden with bright yellow chrysanthemums), but it was so small! Nonetheless, we were able to make the room work for us and appreciated the fact that, even on in a hotel on the busy Boulevard Saint-Michel, we didn't hear the noise of the traffic. In fact, when we returned ten days later and were put in a larger room, I missed our little room with the pleasant view. The hotel had free internet (if you bring your own computer) and a little refrigerator which we used to store cheese and bread. We ate at the hotel one morning, but, over the course of our stay, preferred to have bread and cheese in our room and save our money for nice lunches. The little cafe adjacent to the hotel was a pleasant spot for dinner when we were too tired to go out for a big event dinner. BTW--if you're looking for a restaurant guide, definitely look at Pudlo as an alternative to Michelin. If you haven't heard of Pudlo, just type Pudlo Paris into the Amazon.com search engine. He also has books reviewing various regions of France. The people at the front desk were courteous. I especially appreciated that, even though we arrived about 11:00 a.m., our room was ready and we were allowed immediate access to it (which might not be the case during a more busy season). Luxembourg Gardens is only a half block away. A not terribly appealing Franprix is half a block away, but is adequate for replenishing breakfast supplies. A Monoprix, between a quarter mile and half mile away, is a preferable spot for groceries. The major drawback of the hotel is its location on the RER line. That location is excellent if you're arriving from the airport with little luggage, but if you're going to the standard tourist sights (e.g. the Louvre), you walk a considerable distance changing subway lines. At some point we realized we were better off walking half a mile to a different line (perhaps the green) which then gave us direct access to sights we wanted to see. On the plus side, the location isn't as crowded as parts of Boulevard Saint-Michel that are closer to the Seine. My best guesstimate is the hotel is a ten minute walk to the Pantheon and a twenty minute walk to Rue Muffetard. The hotel was clean, including the bathrooms. I have sometimes have trouble walking so the subway issue was relatively important to me and might be a reason I'd choose another hotel for a return trip to Paris. But if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a location near Luxembourg Gardens, and plan to spend most of your time in the 5th, this hotel might be just right for you.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Choice - couldn't have been any better...”
Reviews.Author: Harry-Syd
Reviews.Content: First, some repeats: the hotel is a conveniently located straight shot from the RER station and on the wonderful Blvd. St. Michel, a short walk form the Jardins Luxembourg and the Seine, Pont Neuf, Notre Dame and the Sorbonne. The location is absolutely the best. Almost everything is a short walk or easily reached via the RER train. OK! That done, what really makes any hotel, besides the facilities such as room size, furnishings etc etc is the quality, professionalism, diligence and personal interest of the staff. This hotel group (of 3 hotels within a small radius) has some really great people working there. When the internet stopped working at this hotel, the Front Office Duty Manager Moustafa took us on a grey rainy morning to the Hotel Relais Saint jacques where the absolutely charming & delightful Front Office Manager Seima (Sayma) welcomed us as old friends with cups of Espresso and biscuits in the lounge while we surfed our next destination. Really, really good, helpful, staff which enhances your experience exponentially. I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel and stay in this or one of the hotels in the group when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/service and location”
Reviews.Author: il0veeur0pe
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Observatoire Luxembourg. The staff was very helpful. It was an ideal location in the Latin Quarter, and really close to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for exploring Paris!”
Reviews.Author: KateRoanoke_VA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located - it was easy to get there on the RER from CDG airport. We stayed there a week - had a corner room on the second floor. The room was big enough for 2. The bed was very comfortable, wonderful smooth cotton sheets. Fairly quiet with the windows closed - lots of street noise with them open. Great bathroom - marble, deep soaking tub. Great place to take a bath with the windows open so you can listen to the street sounds of Paris! Hotel staff was uneven - the woman on days wasn't particularly friendly but the night staff was nice - Amene was particularly friendly and helpful. They are more front desk staff and not concierges. Would definitely stay there again - be sure to stop by the pastry shop just down the street called "Friends" - best Pain Au Chocolate and chocolate chaud around - great way to start the day!

Reviews.Title: “The horror!”
Reviews.Author: lapis-philosophorum
Reviews.Content: There is no excuse for a dirty bathroom. It was apparently clean. So I was horrified when I realized the shower wall was plastered with long black hair from the previous occupier. Shocking... The bathroom though is a bit of a relic from the past. It's tiled in grayish marble and looks like a Stasi interrogation room. I kind of liked that. The rest is depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Parisians Being Nice to Americans”
Reviews.Author: caballerogal
