Reviews.Content: We've all heard how unfriendly Parisians can be to Americans. My previous visits to Paris supported this claim. My experience at this hotel has made me think it is no longer true. The staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. We appreciated the location of this hotel. It was just a block from a subway stop and within walking distance to Notre Dame. The rooms were small, as you would expect in Paris, but were clean. The beds were typically "European-hard" which I found a little uncomfortable. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel because we thought the price was very high. The little restaurant next door was very good for croissants for breakfast. We also had dinner there one night and found it very good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: stronger123
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location, great access to Metro Train/Bus/RER. Very friendly, English speaking staff, good sized rooms (for Parisian standards), extremely clean and comfy, nicely decorated non-smoking rooms with garden views. Included AC, TV (CNN and BBC in English), good quality toileteries, hair dryer, fresh linen, minibar, locker, room service and good breakfast. Ver safe and secure to store your cameras and laptops, free wi-fi. This hotel is located on the famous Boulevard St. Michel and is just steps away from the Luxembourg gardens which is a great place to just relax and rest after lunch. Its 2 bus stops away from the Pantheon and Notre-dame. Its abt a 20 min walk or 2 stops away from the bustling St. Michel-St. Germaine intersection and there is a wide variety or cafe's and restaurants nearby to enjoy a shot of expresso or a pain au chocolat and a glass of champagne at night. There is also a number of shops and grocery stores (monoprix) nearby. Infact the access to all sightseeing places is so convienient from this hotel that we did not need a single cab ride and used the Metro to cover everything in our 5 day vacation even though it was our first Paris trip. We would definitely go back and recommend it to everyone without any hesistation.

Reviews.Title: “very very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gango123456
Reviews.Content: located near Jardin du Luxembourg, middle of town, the staff are very nice and helpfull, good breakfast and the rooms a bit small but very comfortable and convenient, and with A.C

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_gypsy
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at 2pm our room was not yet ready. Due to the late check out the hotel offers this is understandable. The staff were very apologetic and helpful in holding our bags for us. When we eventually got into our room it at first didn't strike me as the glamorous pictures I had seen on the website but to be honest they do live up to the general idea given on the site. They have a tidy decor, neat, very clean, quiet, air conditioned, excellent bathroom facilities (the shower was hot and water plentiful), marvelous windows from which to hang out and watch Paris go by. We didn't hear any other hotel guests or outside noise during our 3 day stay. Our room was on the 3rd floor facing the rear of the hotel with a good view into some gardens. We stayed 3 days and found the rooms to be adequate for our needs as light travellers. However if you travel with large suitcases you will find it very cramped. We used the stairs a lot although a lift is available. Staff were excellent, friendly and happy to endure my school girl French however English is perfectly fine. We often got back to the hotel at 1 or 2am and the reception was attended, you just have to ring the bell to get the door opened. Location to the RER is a 30 second walk away. Restaurant area is 5 minutes away. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel staff, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: NYMonkey99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 8 nights at the Observatoire and we had an excellent experience. Remember this is not the Plaza Hotel, but a very good petit hotel in Paris. If you get a good rate, you will not be sorry you stayed at this hotel. The positives: 1. The hotel staff were all excellent and very helpful, especially Mustafa. He truly made us feel as if we were family members staying in his home. 2. The hotel chamber service was excellent. Our room and the hotel was extremely clean. 3. The rooms were very comfortable, but remember if coming from the U.S. not very large as are most Parisian Hotels. The rooms were not in any way cramped and the beds were very comfortable. 4. Location is excellent. The hotel was not in the hustle and bustle of the tourist scene areas, but only minutes walking distance to the mayhem from the hotel, which allowed for the room to be very quiet. Right accross the street is Luxembourg Gardens (A great place to lay on the grass looking at the gardens and palace and open a bottle of wine with cheese and french bread at the end of a long day!) 5. The Luxembourg Metro station is across the street and the Latin Quarter and Montparnasse are less than 10 minutes walking distance away. Negatives: (These are the reasons I did not give the hotel five out five.) 1. The bathrooms were kept spotlessly clean by the staff and quite comfortable, but they are dated and need to be spruced up a bit. 2. The furniture in the lounge area was quite worn and in need of replacing. The furniture took away from a space that could be a very comfortable meeting area for friends or for waiting for your wife to put on her make-up. Tips: Make sure to request a room facing the gardens behind the hotel. It backs on to a very quiet lane and the view of the garden is wonderful. Also, there are Paris City bike loaners behind the hotel along the quiet lane which makes for an interesting, fun and eco-friendly way to get around Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location. Staff helpfull”
Reviews.Author: scottish_9
Reviews.Content: Was my first time in Paris and went with my partner for 2 days in July and was very happy with everything. The location was great, very close to restaurants, bars and 10 minutes walk from Notre Damn. The room was very comfortable and the toilet an excellent size. Very clean and the staff were very helpful with any queries we had regarding getting about. Compared to other hotels it was great value for money and would recommend this hotel. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for great location”
Reviews.Author: blcNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Observatoire Luxembourg hotel this week with my wife and had a very good time. We were able to get a very good rate on Expedia. We had a quiet room to the back of the hotel overlooking a wonderful private garden. Management is constantly renovating the property, we saw painters at work, in some rooms they were changing carpets. Wireless for free! So definetely a great value

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic location!!”
Reviews.Author: travelingirl81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently celebrated our first anniversary at Hotel Observatoire Luxembourg. It is located in a great neighborhood for exploring the city. Quiet, but centrally located to many restaurants/attractions. Luxembourg Gardens are beautiful!! Moustafa and the other front desk personnel were extremely helpful and responsive to our requests. They also provided many great restaurant suggestions.. Only negative, as others mentioned, the rooms are definitely on the smaller side.. They were able to move us to a slightly larger room after the first night though. Also, do NOT use phone # on nightstand to make international telephone calls, VERY expensive. Overall, not a luxury hotel, but great location and service--a terrific stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for easy access to top attractions”
Reviews.Author: flomer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Observatoire Luxembourg was very charming. I had a great view of a private garden. Moustafa and Amine made my stay in Paris amazing, by the second day they knew my name as well as my room number. Whenever I needed tips of where to eat or visit, they provided me with perfect suggestions. I was able to enjoy the many sides of Paris. The Hotel is truly located in a location that makes accessing the top Paris attractions a breeze. The metro system was easy to understand.

Reviews.Title: “charming but expensive view on the jardins du luxembourg”
Reviews.Author: KatjeBrussels
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel if a bit expensive for what it offers. The bathrooms, the room carpets, the TV sets and the bed linen could do with a renewal but the decor is charming and if you get a room on the rear garden (which I requested) you can be sure to have quiet night and a lovely view. The location is fantastic close to the jardins du luxembourg and all the faculties. Due to the presence of students it is a very lively area and full of nice little restaurants and bars. Breakfast is ok not fantastic but I was there for a week and what was there was always fresh. My main complaint is on the price which is too high...yes even for Paris! I didn't pay as I was on a business trip but this is not worth the 200€ they usually ask. If you get a promotion rate then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghYorkieman
Reviews.Content: This is a typical 'simple Paris hotel'. There are no frills - little service - but the rooms are very clean. The trick is not too expect too much from it....and therefore not to pay too much in the first place. If you're paying E200/night, you're going to be disappointed. If you're paying E120/night, then this place is absolutely fine. In the end, you're in Paris! If you're spending more than 7hrs per 24hrs in the hotel, you need to get out more! This is a place to sleep between travel around the city: nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Clean! Courteous! Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: blknjiggy
Reviews.Content: I was so nervous when I booked this hotel because of the most recent review, which was horrible, but I finally just bit the bullet and made the reservation. I requested a superior double room with two single beds. Being the control freak I am, I made sure to email them directly with our specific requests, and they responded promptly. We took the train from CDG and in 30 minutes we were dropped off steps from the hotel door. The hotel is very well maintained, and we waited in the very nice sitting area where Mustafa tried his best to accomodate us 3 hours before the actual check in time. That is where we first noticed the cleaning. The hotel in SPOTLESS and they insist on cleaning everything again to be sure. My friend and I just for fun tried to find spots to run our fingers against to see if there was dirt...Nothing. We dropped off our bags and had breakfast next door. The hotel is also located minutes away from the Sorbonne and on the Blvd St. Michel which was very convenient. We were two adult males and our room was large enough for both of us, two checked bags and two carry ons.. not as tiny as I was imagining considering the reviews. (the lift however seems to have two person max or 1 adult and two big bags.) The room had a lovely view of a beautiful small garden and a quiet street. The bathroom was well appointed and also clean. I am 5'11 and my feet were not dangling anywhere off the beds. The beds were also comfortable enough for us to recover after our nights of partying. Everything in the room worked, t.v. safe. mini-fridge, lighting, phone, strong internet signal from the 4th floor, etc. Lovely windows and very charming decor. The night manager (forget his name) was incredibly personable, extremely nice and very helpful. Everyone spoke English. As much as I spoke French, after a night of partying, the last thing I wanted to do was conjugate verbs,, etc. So I was happy when they realized this and spoke English. When leaving, the front desk was very attentive asking if we wanted a taxi, but that was unnecessary since the RER was right outside. This is not the Ritz-Carlton but neither is the price so all in all it was great that I followed my instinct and booked the room. The hotel is very clean, very well located and very good staff. I would certainly return. P.S. When taking the train from CDG, try to get in the front of the train and exit at the exit closet to the front at the Luxembourg station.... Walking down the Blvd St. Michel is actually fun and good for shopping.... Buy 10 tickets at the metro station, it works out cheaper and the tickets can be used to enter the RER stations where you can connect easily to the metro...There is a supremarket steps away from the hotel where you can buy stuff instead of using the mini-bar.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible little hotel”
Reviews.Author: frenchquartersandi
Reviews.Content: I never expect much from the hotels in Paris unless I pay a high price but this little boutique of a hotel is not what it claims to be and they are real rip off artist. I booked a room which was a Superior Deluxe recently renovated to the highest standards. When I checked in I was given a double bed not a queen in a very tiny room. You could barely walk around the bed without hitting it. Needless to say not any room for bags which I had three since I was spending over a month in Europe. There was very little lighting in the room and the room stayed very cold despite the fact that I adjusted the heat. Just so you know I am hot blooded so it takes a lot to get me cold. The shower was so tiny that my 6 foot husband had a hard time getting into it and there was no tray to hold shampoo or soap in the shower. The rug was worn out and very dirty and I don't know where the pictures came from on their site but it didn't even resemble my room. The walls are very thin and I could hear every word that was said in the next room and not to mention on the street. When you leave you have to give them your room key and they give it back on arrival. They have a breakfast room and when we checked in the staff told my husband to please enjoy the breakfast in the morning. The food is typical of most breakfast foods in Europe. Bread, cheese, ceral, fruit, coffee, so every morning while I was getting ready to go out he would go have breakfast and bring up a cup of coffee and croissant for me. When we got ready to check out we found out we were being charged 20 euros each for breakfast. Most expensive croissant I every had. The reason I am really upset about this is because the way the staff indicated to my husband the breakfast was included in the price. I booked this room because of all the good reviews and I was highly disappointed in this hotel. I stayed at over 10 hotels during my month stay in Europe and most were so charming , clean and everything they claim to be but if you decide to stay here be aware of the many problems. The only good thing I can say about this place is location, location, location and the maid did a nice job of cleaning the room although they don't replace any products or towels that are used.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful with this one”
Reviews.Author: mandeville-travels
Reviews.Content: Booked via hotel's website for 3 nights and specifically requested two beds. Arrived to find a tiny room ('superior') with tiny double bed and very tired decor. Went back to reception to find two other women who had also been given a double after requesting two beds. Basically told by the desk staff that if was our fault, or the agents' fault because the agents 'don't understand their booking system' and that we would have to make do for the night and they would see what they could do in the morning. We were told that the double bed was actually two singles and they would remake the bed in the morning as twins. We were then abruptly ordered back to the room to check this was the case. The bed was clearly a double - in any case the room was so tiny that it would have been impossible to accommodate two single beds. Back down to reception, this time with the booking confirmation - pointed out the request for two beds - whilst the French was not perfect it was clear that was what was required. Manager then acknowledged this, apologised and we were given a much better room with two beds. At this point we assumed that the matter had been resolved. The next evening we called at reception to pick up our key and the desk clerk informed us that he had taken the original booking and then proceeded to lecture us on how it was really our fault as we had made an incorrect booking and had asked for a double - this less than 24 hours after the management had apologised for their error. If a double is standard, then it seems pointless to request one specifically. What part of '2 beds please', did he not understand?? As the desk clerk appeared to want to make an issue of this and continued to harangue us, we took the key told him that we considered the issue resolved and walked off, fuming. In any case, if it was not clear what we were requesting, then an email to me would have clarified what we wanted. If the hotel then did not want to take a twin booking, then we could have cancelled and looked elsewhere. This hotel clearly has a problem with its bookings and the website lacks clarity. On the first night the duty manager told us 'this happens all the time' and two incorrect bookings on one evening would suggest this is the case. The hotel does not appear to recognise that two people travelling together are not necessarily sleeping together. With the exception of the woman who finally sorted out our room (and who appeared to be staying after hours to do this) the staff were rude and unhelpful. Nothing was their fault, the 'take it or leave it' attitude was disappointing. Although the room eventually provided was beautiful, well maintained and clean, the hotel is in a convenient location, and with a good brasserie attached, our overall response was negatively influenced by the unhelpful attitudes of the staff on the first night and by the appalling behaviour of the desk clerk on the second night. I have rated the staff at 2, without the intervention of the helpful duty manager on the first night I doubt if I could have rated the staff at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LardB0y
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights while attending a conference. I did not pay for it, so cannot comment on value for money, but it is a very nice establishment. Handily located for the RER, but to be honest you can walk to most of the central sights and locations. In a nice area, still lively but a little less hectic than further up the Boulevard St Michel. Luxembourg Gardens just across the road are a delight. Very helpful staff, spotlessly clean. Rooms okay size (by paris standards), and mine was slightly stuffy, but not a big problem. Definitely worth considering for a Paris trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: fronya
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel ... it was the best way to end our honeymoon after spending the previous week in Provence. Just splendid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: sunniekate
Reviews.Content: We had a difficult time finding an affordable hotel in October that was in a good location and were pleased to find this hotel via Trip Advisor. The location is great and right near the gardens. The rooms and bathrooms are a nice size, clean and comfortable. For someone used to staying at cushy Hyatt beds in the US, this wasn't exactly it, but it certainly was perfect for the 4 nights we were in Paris. Our room faced the busy street side but was okay with the windows closed. Ask for a room on the side of the hotel facing the other street side (not sure if it would cost more however). The three members of the front desk staff were incredibly helpful and helped make it a nice experience. I would certainly return for another soiree in Paris and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: bizmanCharlotteNC
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in Paris. My travel agent recommended the Hotel Observatoire and I trust her. We were not disappointed. The reception people were great. They mapped just about everything for us and listened politely as we tried to speak French. The reception staff's English was way better than my French. Yes the hotel room was small but most are in Europe. This hotel has about 40 rooms and was spotless. The location was ideal for walking and seeing the sites. This hotel is about 1/2 block from the Luxembourg stop off the RER B. Do yourself a favor and take the time to familiarize yourself with the RER system and you will save time and money. The hotel breakfast was acceptable however 2 blocks up the street and one block left you will find a pastry shop with awesome croissants and breads. The hotel is right across the street from Luxembourg gardens. You will want to take a stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Was just Ok for me”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Traveller51
Reviews.Content: While there is no doubt this is a great location, close to a train station (which is different to, but connects with, the Metro) I was a little disappointed with this hotel. The room was extremely hot, and the airconditioning didn't work, so we had to sleep with the window open. We were on the first floor, and the traffic was actually quite noisy. The room was small, but you expect that, and really you are only there to sleep! But the bed was tiny! We are not tall people, but my feet were hanging off the end of the bed! The bathroom was nice though, big bath, and the desk staff seemed nice enough. I just wonder if there isn't better accommodation in Paris for similar money?

Reviews.Title: “My Return to Paris”
Reviews.Author: DMSpin
Reviews.Content: My stay @ Hotel Observatoire - Luxembourg was a great experience. The reason why I picked this hotel, b/c when I did my study abroad in the summer of 2002, I stayed @ a student hostel which was down the block from the hotel. The area is great and there are a lot of places to go eat. If you drink a lot of water like I do, when you walk out of the hotel to the left about 5 to 6 store fronts over is a small supermarket. The water is Paris isn't expensive. As for the room, it was a good size room. As the other reviews say, rooms in Paris aren't big as the standard rooms in the US. The hotel doesn't have full size beds, they have twin size beds in the room for two. I am not a twin size person since I am 6'3 but I was able to deal. I stayed in room 104 and it had a great bathroom. The cleaning Lady came in everyday and did a great job. One day she even left us a little treat. Fresh towels everyday and she did a good. As for noise from the street, it would bug a person who doesn't live in a Major City in the US. I was able to take the RER B line to Luxembourg Train stop and the station is across the street from the hotel. Tip!!! If you are taking the train to the hotel from CD airport, get on the first car of the train b/c it will leave you at the exit you need that leaves you across the street from the hotel. If you are looking to go to dinner, the best thing you can do is go to Latin Quarters and you have find a deal for dinner. One place I would recommand is a small place called "El Bistro Latino" which is typical food from Spain. The address is 5,rue de la Harpe. You can find Rue de la Harpre when you are walking down on Blvd Saint Michel and the coner of Saint Germain. It's not expensive and you will have a great time with friends or family. The only english channel you can get on the hotel TV is CNN which was good for me. I did enjoy seeing the Music channels like MTV and MCM which play English and French music. When we left the hotel, we checked out @ 6am since our flight was leaving @ 9am. We didn't want to take the train so we booked a "Yellow Van" with the front desk the day before we left. It's a cheap way to get to the airport and we had to leave half of the cost of the trip with the front desk. It was much cheaper then taking a cab. For a group of 4, we paid 17 Euro per person verus the 50 Euro you'll pay with a cab. My final advice is, if you are looking for a clean hotel and a good place to sleep, this hotel is good. Don't spend so much money on expensive hotels and save the money to go shopping in Paris. One last advice, the day b4 you go on your vacation, check the exchange rate and remember you will always get the best exchange rate from ATM. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me. When I return to Paris, I will be returning to this hotel. Danny

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel on Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: IreneSantaMonica
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 4 nights at this lovely hotel and were sad to leave. The staff was always helpful and friendly, English speaking and kind. We requested a room on an upper floor facing the street and got a charming corner room on the 4th floor. We loved looking out the two large windows to the street below. It was perfectly quiet. The hotel is located so close to the station that when you come up the stairs you look up and see your hotel and feel so lucky. The restaurant downstairs is very convenient and reasonable, we ate there twice. We pampered ourselves and had breakfast sent up to our room one rainy morning and were very pleased with the service and selection. A very short walk takes you into the Luxembourg Gardens. Strolling down St. Michel is a perfect way to experience the neighborhood. Also, the Pantheon is a short walk away and the cafes surrounding it are quaint and lovely. The room is perfectly cleaned every day, the sheets and bed are comfortable and yes, the room is small in a charming Parisian way. This hotel is a good deal for the price and wonderful location. We would stay there again..Thank you Olivier, and others whose names I don't know for making us feel so welcome every time we came though the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: catJersey
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights Derc 2007 from Boxing day Room small as expected for Paris but very clean, bathroom large and immaculate, asked for quiet room and got one, it was great, bed comfortable, location great, RER station outside door, mini bar you can put your own drinks in to keep cool, close to some great parisian restaurants. Will definately be staying there again when we return in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: freeline
Reviews.Content: Great location for a short stay with the luxembourg u/ground station right across the street , which takes you to cdg without getting off. Room was good size ,as was the toilet. Latin quarter was 5 min . walk away . We stayed in room 203 which faced onto the back street which looked onto gardens. Would stay again .Also have a room to keep your luggage in if you have a late flight and still want to see some more of paris without lugging your cases around

Reviews.Title: “A great base for the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: brynsdad
Reviews.Content: We knew the area from previous visits to Paris, but not the hotel. It was definitely a find - nice service, pleasant (very clean) rooms and a brilliant location. The little "Loco" bar/cafe attached to the hotel was a real plus - a proper locals' place complete with families having Sunday lunch and Sorbonne students doing their homework over a coffee in the evening. Paris was surreally quiet due to the transport strike during our stay, but the absence of a metro or bus was not a problem - having Notre Dame, the Pantheon area , St Sulpice, Ile St Louis etc all within 20 minutes or so stroll, and the Luxembourg Gardens a strone's throw away can't be bad. The Bouillon Racine restaurant is as beautiful inside as everyone else says, but we were a wee bit disappointed by the food, possibly because the previous evening we'd been to Bofinger in Rue Bastille which was quite exceptional, with both brilliant food and service (the waiters even managed to persuade a brasserie of rather prim Parisians to serenade my wife with "Bonne Anniversaire a toi" whilst presenting her with a most impressive indoor firework!). We preferred the Polidor Restaurant on Rue Monsieur-le-Prince, terrific value simple menu and very atmospheric, complete with a cast of mainly taciturn Allo Allo extras making up the staff.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE - Check Out Scam”
Reviews.Author: fsaint
Reviews.Content: BEWARE of this hotel due to a one-of-a-kind money scam which they may attempt at check out time. This place is your typical Parisian hotel with tiny cell-like rooms and bathrooms so small that even a kid would have to sit sideways on the toilet, but it served our purposes well until they played a sour note at the very end. We stayed at similar 3-star hotels on our trip, as well as the fabulous 5-star Trianon Palace in Versailles and never encountered a “policy” like we encountered at this hotel. When checking out using same-as-cash travelers’ checks in euro denominations, they keep the change. Be it 1 euro or 99 euros, they somehow feel that it is their right to keep the change. It is an insulting policy or a downright scam which can simply be countered by using traveler's checks for the larger even amount of the bill and paying cash or using a credit card for the uneven amount of the remainder. But again, it’s not a 3% or 5% surcharge. It’s not a 5 or 10 euro flat fee. It’s simply an insulting, “They keep the change.” It took a real idiot on their management team to come up with that one. More importantly, the policy is not stated or posted at any time or anywhere. Then again, who in their right mind would post such a thing for normal-thinking people to see? This hotel was never on our list of choices for this trip, but our AAA travel agent couldn’t find anything else in our selected areas due to a major tennis tournament and medical conference in town on our dates. If you are considering Hotel Observatoire Luxembourg, keep searching. You can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: libarb
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. Although the rooms are small by American standards, there was room to walk around the bed. The housekeeping staff does an excellent job: the room was always immaculate and bathroom supplies (shampoo, bath wash, towels, etc.) were replenished daily. The room was nicely decorated and although there was no dresser, there is a refrigerator, a desk, and night stands. In addition, there's a safe in the closet. The concierge staff was very good and Mussafa is excellent. My camera battery charger broke on the second day and he sent me to a huge camera store in the Chatelet metro station mall. He knew of all of the attractions and the best metro route to get to them. The hotel is right across the street from a metro station and a bus stop, which makes transportation very easy. The views from both the main street (Blvd. St Michel) and back of the hotel (overlooking a garden) are lovely. Even on the main street side, the noise wasn't bad. There's also air conditioning, which is nice on a warm day. We were there for 10 nights and have absolutely no complaints. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, good location”
Reviews.Author: uberplanner19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in July. The room was about standard for European hotel rooms in terms of size. it was very clean (the bathroom was spotless!), and the bed comfortable. We were in a street-facing room (blvd San Michele), which is a major thoroughfare in Paris, but the windows were incredible, blocking all street sounds. The staff was helpful and the restaurant attached to the place was pretty good, too. It's not right next to any attractions other than the Parc du Luxembourg, but centrally located near a lot of things, and anyway when we travel, we like to walk, and so we just walked up the blvd San Michele to anywhere we wanted to go. There is a metro station right on the corner, though (great patisserie right outside it, too!), which is how we got to and from Garre du Nord. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: vanlea73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Observatoire Luxembourg for one night last week and really would have liked to stay longer. We booked through Air Miles and were expecting to perhaps be put in a smaller room as a result. We couldn't have been more delighted. We had a really good sized room with all you could desire, two windows which overlooked the excitement of Boulevard St Michel (with the windows shut and curtains drawn at night you couldn't hear any noise). The bathroom was gorgeous with Roger & Gallet complimentaries no less. Breakfast was okay with a decent selection of food, including scrambled egg and saucisson. We found the front desk staff really helpful and pleasant at all times. We enjoyed the convenience of the hotel's proximity to Luxembourg RER station but the best thing of all was its nearness to the beautiful Jardin de Luxembourg which we walked through to get into town each day. If you don't like walking then perhaps the hotel may be a little too far down Boulevard St Michel for you but we found it an ideal spot to explore the left bank. Really delighted with our find.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Traveler60614
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and everything, but the location is pretty out of the way. Not within walking distance of any Paris sights. The room was ok with a nice bathroom but pretty dingy bedroom. Many stains on the walls and the street noise was hard to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't return to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: paris_traveler093
Reviews.Content: I have been going to this hotel often. But this was the first time I managed to get a discount package through Expedia. And I guess the new management at the hotel did not like it at all. Can you believe that when I arrived they told me that they did not have any room available because one of their guests was sick and could not move out of the room! And so they sent me (for the first night) to a terrible and much cheaper hotel! And by the way, I couldn't do much about it because Expedia charges you for everything when you purchase the package. Anyway, the management of the hotel (at least the gentleman I dealt with) was rude and did not fail to remind me more than once that I had not paid full price for the hotel. It was not a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Convenient and Welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: Artiste75
Reviews.Content: I felt welcome from the responses to my original emails regarding accommodations and booking for myself and my adult art students till the day we left and sadly said our goodbyes. Our rooms were quiet and cleaned to perfection. The hotel staff was always friendly and happy to help make our stay most enjoyable. We're looking forward to a return visit to the hotel so we can share more good times with our special new friends in the office at the reception desk!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: neengay
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay. This is a lovely little hotel with a terrific location, friendly and helpful staff and a wonderful view! Bedrooms are small but our bathroom was large with a great tub perfect for soaking after walking all day. (Treat yourself to some lavendar bubble bath from the bath shop down the street!) Breakfast was perfect. The bistro attached to the hotel was great! My only complaint was with hard pillows! Hint: If your room is on Blvd. San Michel just pull the drapes and it's quite sound-proof!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, good-value hotel...”
Reviews.Author: kaypasa55
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here in early May; we had booked a package with Eurostar from London for an overnight stay; I chose this area as I am well familiar with Paris and the Latin Quarter/Luxembourg Gardens is my favorite neighborhood. We arrived before noon and the room was not yet ready but they graciously accommodated our overnight bags while we went for lunch nearby. When we got back, our room was prepared - it was clean and looked on to a back street with a beautiful view of a private, lovely landscaped garden which I believe is part of a school for the deaf. The bathroom was small but more than adequate, the beds comfy and the people working the reception were super friendly and helpful. The big bonus is having the RER train station practically across the street - this provides access to the airport, the Gare du Nord train station and the metro system ... I have stayed in numerous hotels in Paris and feel this one, albeit a small-scale hotel, to be a very good value given the high cost of Paris accommodations... I would definitely return again in the future -

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerOakland_CA
Reviews.Content: Right across the Boulevard St. Michel from the Luxembourg Gardens, this little gem of a hotel is a great bargain for Paris. My wife and I stayed here about 40 years ago and liked it then, but it has been completely modernized since then, probably recently, and upgraded to three star status. It is just a few steps from an exit of the RER Luxembourg station which connects with all the Paris Metro and RER as well as directly (no changes of trains) with Chas. De Gaulle and Orly airports, and the Gare du Nord. The staff were helpful in every way and all speak flawless English. The rooms we stayed in (we stayed there twice during the same trip) were large by French standards, very clean with comfortable beds and modern heat, A/C, and TV controls. The breakfast (extra) was excellent and a good value. While not cheap, the price was certainly a good value, considering the high cost of everything in Paris. You can book directly on the hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: just60
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on the main Bvd St Michel and 1 min from tube station and jardin de Luxembourg. Some rooms like ours are quiet and overlook a private garden. We stayed 27 to 30 April and our room was small but well equipped with shower and air con. Pleasant staff who offered us free champagne and dinner to celebrate our birthday and anniversary ! Very friendly and helpful staff also in the on site Le Luco Bistro which serves good food. Nice walk to the Latin Quartier restaurants, Notre Dame and Pantheon. Bus 38 outside hotel connects to Gare du Nord and five minutes from l'Opentour orange bus stop. Excellent situation away from the center of town but very good connections. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice.”
Reviews.Author: GranadaHills2005
Reviews.Content: It is very quiet and clean. Very small rooms but the view are great especially if you are facing the back gardens. We were traveling w/ a lot of BIG bags and it was great that they can store them for us as they would have not fitted in our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “No way to cancel a night!”
Reviews.Author: EncoreSurLaRoute
Reviews.Content: The hotel was almost empty, and I guess that's why the director of this hotel decided to charge me the 3rd night like a "No Show", if I wanted to quit a day before. Even if you have a very a good reason to leave before...So I do not recommend this hotel to anyone, you will have to notice 48 hours the hotel if you want to leave earlier! The rooms are extraordinary small for the rate and nb of stars (3)! The bathroom too especially all rooms x07, like 107, 207 ,307, 407... Can't do any picture of the rooms: it is too small. The rest is okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and good location”
Reviews.Author: montypythonphoenix
Reviews.Content: good location , take the train directly to luxembourd station and it is right there, do not waste money foe taxi, good english speaking staff and do not fooled by the breaakfast they give , it is not included in the price - confirm, confirm, confirm. overall a good place and helpful staff(do not need to get help anywhere else)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, even better hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: Misplaced-Ranger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights here in Feb. We were pleasantly surprised at how close the hotel is to the Luxembourg RER stop. It is within walking distance to the Latin District, and a short subway or cab ride from everything else. Even better was the service from the three different people working behind the desk during our stay. These people took care of us in every way possible. We had a great stay, and will come back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: basro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a wonderful first vacation to Paris. The Hotel Luxembourg Observatoire was wonderful. We were only 60ft from the RER B/metro station and thus were able to take the train from CDG international to our hotel. The room was small but clean, the bed very comfortable, 1 min walk to the wonderful Jardin de Luxembourg, etc. The front desk staff were wonderfully friendly. Cons: a tad loud as the hotel was on main street rue st michel I would stay here again, but I would prefer a quieter hotel closer to St Germain De pres.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: Scousejetsetter
Reviews.Content: Although the room was of a small size the position of the hotel more than makes up for it. It is literally opposite a Metro stop that runs straight from CDG airport. As for the staff, they could not be more helpful or accommodating. For value for money, this hotel is right up there and when (not if) we visit Paris again, this hotel will be one we definitely check out. If you get the chance, make sure you eat in the restaurant attached to the hotel. We ate on the last night and wished we had earlier. Fabulous food.

Reviews.Title: “Really Special Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: denssharon
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were so happy to be able to check-in. Nicolas was so very pleasant to us. We had a corner room which was wonderful. We requested a shower and it was easy to get in and out of. We had a desk and chair, 2 twins,small refrigerator,closet, and drawers. We loved the location. The #38 bus picks you up right in front of the hotel. We took a cab from CDG but you could take the RER B if you wanted to although there is no escalator going down the stairs. With luggage this could be tough. Our cab cost us 45 euros. You are about 2 blocks down and 3 up to the Pantheon. Many mornings we grabbed a cappucino and went to the Luxembourg Gardens and enjoyed the wonderful park. Mc Donalds is right across from the entrance and very cheap for a drink. Dinners we took the #38 to St Germain. There are loads of restaurants of all types at very good prices. There is a small corner store across the street from the hotel were you can get fresh fruit, milk soda etc. with the refrigerator this is very handy. We wanted to take a tour to Normandy and Giverney Niolas was so great setting up everything for us. Noutina the night manager was so pleasant to us the morning we went to Normandy. Nothing was too much trouble for these two gentlemen. The hotel was extremely clean and modern. We will definitely stay at this hotel again. This was our 3rd trip to Paris and the best. We wanted to sincerely thank the staff for a wonderful visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: bulldozer
Reviews.Content: Well run small hotel, rooms are small but functional, and Metro station is steps away. Good value for Paris and extremely helpful staff who all speak good English.. Most imortant a comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: NM43
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in the Hotel Observatoire-Luxembourg (6 September 06) and found it a friendly, pleasant, conveniently located hotel. I would not stay there again, however, because I discovered upon arrival that "High speed internet access in all rooms (Wi-Fi network)" (quotation from their web site) is not free. There's a huge charge for it. Being used to staying in cheap motels in the U.S. that offer free wi-fi in every room (e.g., Microtel), the idea of spending four times as much money on a hotel room that charges an exhorbitant fee to use the wi-fi network turned me off big time. I returned to Paris the following week and stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon, where I will happily stay again since I spent quite a bit of time uploading pictures via the FREE wi-fi connectivity (in the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tikkadog
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the RER B line station Luxembourg which is very convenient if you are going to the airport. The Luxembourg Gardens are right across the street. When I checked in they did not have any standard rooms left (I had made the reservation in advance) so the hotel upgraded me to a superior room at no additional cost. If possible try to get a room that is not facing Blvd St. Michel as you can hear the traffic. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful in reconfirming my flight and answering any questions that I had. My room was quite spacious for a Paris hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, quiet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: an5296mn
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and 3 days. We had asked for a standard room but got upgraded to a superior room. Having just arrived from Greece -and having stayed at the terrible Filoxenia in Athens, we didn't have high expectations. Perhaps that is why we were delighted with our room. It was indeed 'the size of a closet' as one another reviewer puts it, but we were told to expect that in Paris. The receptionist was polite and helpful, but not extraordinarily friendly like the Greeks we had stayed with in Santorini's Stelios Place. The website provides poor directions - from the airport, one shouldn't get off at the Notre-Dame, but the next one, I think it goes by the name of Luxumbourg Gardens. Also, the website should clarify that even though the large Gardens are 'across the hotel', the actual entrance is a block or two away. This will clear the expectations of tourists such as the ones who reviewed this hotel above. The problem with this hotel is that it is indeed far (25 minute walk) from the Latin Quarter. It is a quiet residential neighborhood, and therefore most cafes stop serving food after 10 pm, which is quite a shame in summer for tourists who spend their entire day sight-seeing like we did. There is a very nice Jazz bar (le journal?) down the road, and the two attractions that are indeed close by are the Notre Dame and the (Panatheon? spelling?) Also, we spend 100 euros per night per room - for this price, we were hoping for a slightly bigger room and a location closer to latin quarter - with all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time here!”
Reviews.Author: cinqmars
Reviews.Content: First a note on the location. The hotel is about 15 minute walk from the Seine and 10 mins from many bars and restaurants around the Odeon. It is also 5 mins from Boulevard Montparnasse and its historical eateries like the Closerie. One major attraction is the nearby Luxembourg Gardens which can be reached in less than a minute's walk. My girlfriend and i often started the morning wandering through there to get panzerottis and gelato on Rue Vavin. Notre-Dame-Des-Champs Metro is a little over 10 mins walking distance, while the RER is opposite the hotel, as is a bus stop, so it has good transport connections. The hotel itself is very pleasant. The walls and windows are very well insulated so you never hear noise from next door or from outside. One great thing about this hotel is that every room is guaranteed a view, either over St Michel and the Luxembourg Gardens or over the Latin Quarter. The building is very pretty, the decor clean and formal and the layout small and simple. The beds are comfortable and the sheets as nice as anywhere, though the pillows could be a bit softer! Our room (402) had controllable air conditioning, letting you choose how the temp of the room. The staff are exceptionally kind & helpful and managed to add an extra night that we had requested, at the same discount price we originally paid. The attached cafe is ok for a coffee or two at night but you'll be better off getting breakfast or lunch elsehwere. There is a good crepe stand just down the street that is inexpensive. i'd definitely stay here again for a number of reasons, it is excellent value for money, is in a nice location, has good standard of room and of service, and a guaranteed parisien view - something not guaranteed elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Good value - but bring your own sheets if you can”
Reviews.Author: MakeYouHumble!
Reviews.Content: Typical European-style rooms (i.e., not very spacious). But it is very clean, conveniently located near the Metro, as well as the commuter rail which takes you to the airport. Nice restaurant downstairs for breakfast. The bedding felt like sandpaper though - very very cheap. But for the money - everything in Paris is tres cher - it's a good deal for a room in central Paris. Bring your own sheets though.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our last few days in France. It was a great way to end our trip. We loved the rooms and the location. The staff are very helpful and all speak very good English. Their cafe serves excellent coffee and nice patisseries in the morning. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Alice94
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous place for the money. Very convenient location that's close to all tourist sites and far enough away from them to get out of the crowds. Metro stop outside the front door, very quiet, authentic, non-touristy neighborhood with plenty of good places to eat. Yes, the rooms are small, but they are very clean and bright and air conditioned. Above all, the staff is very kind and helpful, and really goes out of their way to help you plan and enjoy your trip, even if that means finding change for the laundromat or looking up good places to shop. The best service I've encountered in ANY hotel, regardless of number of stars. I would absolutely return, and plan to the next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: Asillebanhcs
Reviews.Content: Myself and 14 other girls stayed here for my hen weekend. We all agreed that it was perfect for the occassion. Location was great. Walkable to the Latin Quarter and St Germain, and also had a metro station next door. The cafe attached to the hotel proved to be very handy indeed, particularly when you don't want to have to go far in search of the hang over breakfast and the staff were very friendly. All the rooms were clean and comfortable, ranging in size, but to be honest, it's unlikely that you'll spend much time in it anyway. I didn't actually make it up in time to have breakfast at the hotel, but by all accounts, you are better off going next door! If you are in a big group, I can also highly recommend a restaurant called La Coupole, which is only a short taxi journey away.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfectly Adequate Clean Hotel/ Good Transport Access”
Reviews.Author: Lauralamb
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a very enjoyable 4 nights in Paris at the Observatoire Luxembourg Hotel in the last week of June 2006. It’s years since I have been to Paris so I can only compare it with recent accommodation at a deluxe room at the 5* Le Palais in Prague (twice the price though) where I stayed in May for a week. This is a 3* hotel and that’s exactly what it is. No more, no less. If you want a 5* hotel you need to be prepared to pay the price stay in one. In fact the wardrobe hanging space rail at the Observatoire Luxembourg hotel in each room was twice the rail length of that at Le Palais, although as always taking clothes on your own hangers is best. The linen/beds were clean and firm and there was a small bath. We were given a standard room 101 on arrival and that room is small (but no smaller than many £100+ a night London rooms) with a large bathroom (including bath/shower) overlooking the street. The room arrangement of that room looks exactly like it did on the website picture where I booked withroom to walk around the bed, but it’s not suite like, just a basic clean adequately furnished room. Room 101 was darker than I hoped it would be – it had deep terracotta walls and seemed darker that rainy day than later that week on sunnier days. But both my husband and I thought it perfectly adequate for a few days stay and quite clean and fresh smelling. If we could not have changed rooms we would have been ok with that room. I immediately went to ask for a different off street room and Sabine was exceptionally charming saying they were fully booked, but if I was quick before other guests arrived I could see superior room 103 and 503. The view from 503 of some gardens was really delightful, but I chose 103 on the lower floor as there are no outside fire stairs. The bathrooms were smaller in these latter rooms, but did have both a bath and shower, plus Roget et Gallet toiletries. The room had 1 carver chair and one plain chair and a stool, a 3 drawer chest, a dressing table plus suitcase rack. There was a mirror on the wall and one inside the wardrobe door. There was a fixed bendy tube hairdrier in the bathroom, but I hate those so took my own plus an adaptor. The room turned out to be quiet enough once past 10.00pm. All these 3 rooms were non smoking, all very fresh smelling and not one had evidence of being used by smokers. To get to the fabulous Luxembourg Gardens just cross to the road opposite the hotel entrance then you walk a mere 50 yards down the side street where there is a side entrance to the Gardens. The gardens are not blocks away. They are accessible from the hotel within 100 yards. The buses (no 38) right outside take you up to St Germain or Notre Dame. These two areas are really no distance from the hotel area, but they are not of course just across the street. This is actually a plus as it can be like a madhouse of tourists up there one imagine until all hours. You can see the hordes (including moi) walking over to the St Germain eating area from the Louvre/ Notre Dame at the end of the day. If you are like us you will enjoy ambling along thinking I’m in Paris looking at the bookstalls etc. You can pay the bus driver 1.40 Euro or buy a carnet of 10 tickets for 10.70 Euro at the metro etc. We found the hotel very convenient and easy to get our bearings with it being on a main street. There is little supermarket for extra drinks just 30 metres away and use the room mini bar to store them. We had 3 full days and rode around on the bus a bit to glimpse certain areas, but we specifically visited the Notre Dame, St Chapelle, Sacre Coeur (wonderful) in Montmartre, Musee D’Orsay (marvellous ballroom) and the Louvre (magnificent interior and gold rooms/ceilings apart from the art and the crown jewels) as well as taking in the ambience of the left and right bank just strolling. We also ate out around the area, but especially memorable was a high quality special meal at the lovely restaurant Le Christine in St Germain. The American breakfast at the Hotel was included in our rate. It was nothing special and just filled a hole really. If you want great pastries get them elsewhere, but the fruit salad/creamy yoghurt and coffee were all excellent quality. I would skip it if is not included in your rate. I’ve stayed in great hotels and lesser ones and this is a clean hotel with a bit of wear and tear, but nothing really awful. However if you are used to super slick American standard hotels with massive bathtubs this may not be for you so you need to go 5*. We were more than happy with the Observatoire and enjoyed our break in Paris far more than our May stay in Prague. Paris feels comfortable to walk around. It feels relaxed and happy. There was none of that undercurrent still evident we felt on our Prague trip. Paris is a beautiful city and we are already thinking of going again there is so much more to see and do. You could easily fill a week and still not do everything. We might stay a different part of Paris for another vist, but would be happy to stay at this hotel again. We used a Taxi Parisien (60 Euro with the tip) to get from the airport to the hotel and that was worth it as after the journey you are straight into the taxi rank. We used the RER on our return journey. It took us about 15 minutes to walk the walk to get to our airport carrier from the RER station itself. The RER journey took about 40 minutes so allow an hour for the journey to CDG from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed staying there”
Reviews.Author: Kovnacka
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 206, which overlooked the street. The street noise was not a problem, however, since the windows seem to have good sound isolation. The room itself was rather small, but it didn’t bother us since we spent very little time there. The bathroom was surprisingly big, almost as big as the room--so it felt like we had two rooms! The bathroom was recently remodeled and clean. Having AC in the room was great during the few hot days in Paris. American breakfast buffet was included in our trip package: assortment of croissants, bread, sausage, scrambled eggs and potatoes. Also cheeses, cereals, coffee and juices. The food was fine, however, if I had to pay 15 Euros for it (this is what it cost to buy it), I would most likely rather check out crepes stands down the street. The location is indeed a bit away from the big action spots, but we actually liked that because it kept street noises at night to a minimum. We walked to Notre Dame a few times and explored St Germain and Latin Quarter neighborhoods, but the easiest and cheapest way to get to all other locations is taking metro that is right by the hotel; it was very convenient--just hop on and go anywhere in Paris. The Luxembourg gardens across the street are a nice place for a stroll and people watching. We would certainly stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: queenmaggie
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were standard at best even though we booked for 2-"deluxe" rooms. We traveled w/friends and their deluxe room was the size of a walk-in closet. The deluxe rooms were to be equipped w/coffee maker and was not. Our room phones never worked. We reported it to the desk and they said it would be taken care of. It never was. Our friends room was on another floor and any time we needed to contact them we had to go directly to their room because of the phones. Our complaints were made respectfully but were never taken seriously. The woman at the desk was disinterested and could not be bothered. It was definitely overpriced I would not recommend staying there. Their advertisement is a misrepresentation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Travelers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Observatoire-Luxembourg, and we have nothing but good things to say about the hotel. Location - This is a great location that is close to everything that you need. The RER/Metro station is right across the street, and you can easily walk to all points in the Latin Quarter and St. Germain. We would highly recommend getting the Paris Visit Metro pass. The Metro system is great, and you can get to any major destination in the city right from the station across the street. Make sure you take a few hours to visit Luxembourg gardens, espeicially on the weekend. It is beautiful, and a great place to see Parisians relaxing. Hotel - We had room 504 which overlooked the garden behind the hotel. The room is extremely clean, and the bed was very comfortable. Yes, the room is small, but why would you need a big hotel room in Paris when you are never there? We really liked the quaintness and style of the hotel. We also enjoyed taking a late afternoon nap with the window open so we could hear the sounds of the city and the fountain in the garden. Staff - Each member of the front desk staff was very helpful and pleasant. They were very helpful with dinner recommendations & reservations, answering questions, helping us with our French and giving us directions. They made our staff one to remember for a long time. Food - We had room service for breakfast once, and it was quick and good. We did not eat downstairs or in the attached restaurant, so we can't comment on that. For a quick, inexpensive breakfast, walk past the RER station and visit the crepe stand (see photos). It was fun to watch them make them, and you can't beat a Nutella or egg and fromage crepe for the price. Other stuff - Our best advice would be to bring a good pair of walking shoes. We estimate that we probably walked at least 10 miles a day, sometimes more. Get into the neighborhoods away from the touristy spots. We had a great time exploring the Marais, St. Germaine and Montmartre by just walking the streets and visiting the shops and cafes. Learn a little bit of French before you go. Make an attempt to speak, and you will get respect from the locals. We thought the people in Paris were very friendly and willing to help us with our broken French.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaisyDPetals
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at the hotel. Had a superior room and loved it. Expected it to be very small, but it had plenty of well utilized space, a mini-bar and fridge, coffee maker, large bathroom with towel warmer and robe. Cute decor. Faced St. Michael Blvd, but was always quiet. Heard no noise at night and slept very well. Staff was so friendly and helpful. Restaurant was convenient when the feet were too tired to go very far. RER stop practically outside the door, but be warned if taking the RER from the airport. The airport is confusing and it is hard to find the train station. I would suggest paying the extra money to take the shuttle, as it took us two hours to find the train and we were exhausted. It leaves out of terminal 2 - you will need to take a bus if you are in a different terminal - exit 2c, not 2a, as then you have to trek across the entire terminal with luggage. Only dislike about the hotel - it is slightly, slightly far from the main action. Maybe six blocks to the Seine, which did not seem far at first, but became very, very far after a day of walking. Can easily take RER, however. Overall, hotel far exceeded my expectations - put our fancy hotel in London to shame. A big thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Parisienne Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Jillette
Reviews.Content: The Observatoire far exceeds the usual continental three star standard. In fact, I'd say all that keeps it from it's fourth star is its townhouse size, and the bedroom dimensions. But the rooms are tastefully furnished, the bathrooms are spacious, modern and clean, and the staff are well-trained and very helpful. All seemed to speak excellent English - a plus for those with shameful pidgin French... Breakfast consists of three tasty options, the smallest (and cheapest) being the Petit Parisienne, which we found to be more than enough. It's also served in the glass windowed brasserie which looks out on to the street downstairs - great for people-watchers. The brasserie is also perfect for a pre-dinner/early evening drink, only let down by its closing at 22:00. The quirky St. Germain area is just five minutes away and great for eating out, especially on warmer evenings when the pavements throng with al fresco diners. There was a slight mix-up on our bill - we were charged for two breakfasts each per day, but this was quickly sorted out. Can't complain!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised at the Observatoire-Luxembourg”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by my room at the Hotel Observatoire-Luxembourg. I had heard stories of how small Paris hotel rooms were and lacking in modern conveniences. Not true here. We stayed in a nonsmoking, twin-bed room overlooking a small park. The room had lovely padded fabric wall covering, a desk and chair, a small dresser, 2 side chairs, and a safe. I was delighted that there was a small (stocked) refrigerator in the room as I had medicine that has to be kept cold. The bed was maybe even a tad more comfortable than my comfy bed at home. The ensuite bath included a tub with a shower and little bottles of bath gel and shampoo, like American hotels. The sink was spacious for washing out stockings, etc. In the tub was a clothesline you could pull and hook to the far wall for drying the stockings. Quite handy. When we first arrived, we were disappointed that the Luxembourg Garden was so small. It was a day or so later that we laughed when we realized the little walled garden our room overlooked was just the backyard grounds of a nearby building. The Luxembourg Garden was a block away, on the other side of the hotel, and was more like what I had imagined (except for it being March and the trees bare). The Metro is not even a half block away from the hotel. The neighborhood has a couple of grocery markets and a number of other shops and eateries, and it felt quite safe to walk the street in the evening. The front desk staff was fairly fluent in English and quite helpful, especially Sabrina. I am grateful that we took her advice to take the airport shuttle 3 hours before our flight. The ride to the airport took twice as long as we expected and we didn't have to sweat it like those in the van from other hotels who didn't get the valuable advice. The hotel's website is a little misleading, but we enjoyed our 8-day stay and would be happy to stay there again. Not bad at all for 125€/night.

Reviews.Title: “A Joy of Paris”
Reviews.Author: unmerited1
Reviews.Content: Loved this little hotel. My wife & I stayed here during part 2 of our honeymoon. I wasn't crazy about the size of the room but because of my research, I wasn't caught by suprise. My wife loved the room because it kept us bumping into each other at all times. lol The staff was excellent. I tried to speak french & they had fun laughing at my bad french. As everyone has stated, it's a str8t shot from the airport to this hotel. Great location for walking to the latin quarter & a number of sights. Would definitely recommend this place. Very much so worth the money. There's also this great little store across the street for late night munchies. Has a fruit stand on the outside & all kinds of great goodies inside. I think my wife & I went there every night. By the way, loved that french bathroom...almost as big as the room. lol

Reviews.Title: “charming & great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel Observatoire Luxembourg for a week in late December, 2005. It was a most pleasant stay with a few surprises. Loved the small frig in our room (I always love left-overs from dinners). Delicious breakfast with lots of choices, including a variety of cheese, eggs, sausage, yogurt. Great coffee, bread (of course!) and juices. Very charming and great location. RER and Metro just steps away. Walking distance to the Latin Quarter and to Saint Germain. We actually walked to all of the sites of Paris. Staff was VERY helpful, good service, kind and always clear about arrangements. Charming yes, spatious NO, but not at all uncomfortable. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but request a room off the main street.”
Reviews.Author: researchguy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay. As is generally true, smallish rooms but clean and nice. The front desk staff was very helpful and kind. All spoke English well to very well should your French have a few holes. I am a seasoned traveller and would not hestitate to go here again...with one caveat. One side of the hotel faces Blvd. Saint Michel, a very busy street at ALL hours. The other is off a side street facing out into a large, enclosed park. Upon arrival the heating system was going full speed so I shut it down, but the room was still hot. An open window cooled the room but brought in all the street noise from Blvd. Saint Michel. When the window was closed, the noise level decreased considerably but the heat went up. Should you go during warmer weather, this may be a non-issue as windows will be closed with air conditioning. If you go during colder times, request a room on the park side. As is mentioned in other reviews, very close to the RER and metro. About a 10-15 walk to Notre Dame. And for you wireless people, turn left out the front door and walk about four minutes to a small bar. They serve nice coffee in the morning (and other beverages throughout the day) and have free wireless. Sorry, can't remember the name.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Stay”
Reviews.Author: RockNuvell
Reviews.Content: Like the reviews mention, smallish rooms, well kept and clean. Particularly nice bathroom, modern and very clean. You get what you pay for, which was a nice stay on our case. Mini bar didn't cost a fortune either. The only thing I'd add, is that breakfast was fantastic and only about 6 Euros for both of us! This is because unlike every other person that has written a blog here, we went a block away and experienced the cuisine of Paris (please note: we don't speak a word of french), and I'd highly recommend everyone do this in any city they stay. We didn't eat at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Things Come in Small Packages!”
Reviews.Author: Jetset718
Reviews.Content: After carefully reading reviews of this hotel from this site we did not do two things-eat breakfast at the hotel & ask for an iron (we brought our own!) With that said let me say that we had the most pleasurable stay at this hotel. We stayed for 6 nights from Oct. 11-17. The rooms are small, but what does it matter when the whole city of Paris is at your doorstep. The beds were comfortable and clean. As every reviewer states the location is great! You are just a few blocks away from the Pantheon, Sorbonne, heart of Saint Germain du Pres, the Cluny, & the river, but far enough for the nights to be quiet. The street noise was minimal over night considering its a busy blvd by day. The double pane glass windows help! The english speaking staff (day & night) were extremely hospitable and friendly. They made reservations for dinner for us, (we don't speak French with the exception of pleasantries), chatted about local brasseries, showed us menus and discussed other things to do. They were even interested in the restaurants we dined at & our opinion. Paris has thousands of hotels, we felt like we picked the right one for our budget and expectations. The hotel is what you make of it. All we needed was a good shower & minibar in the room! We got it! Did I mention you could see the Sacre Coeur from our cozy little room? We'll be back! Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “An ok place to stay but Very tiny rooms...”
Reviews.Author: llamafarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the August Bank Holiday - it's well located - just across the road from the Metro and within 5 minutes of the Luxembourg Gardens. The rooms are very small, but nice, and clean. It's an ok place to stay but nothing special and the breakfast is ridiculously expensive for what you get - the buffet option is even worse! Whatever you do, don't turn left looking for alternative breakfasts..we found a hideous little cafe which purported to serve croissants etc - we ended up with five slices of white bread slathered with marg..this (inedible) with a pot of tea for two cost the equivalent of £11 - well, it would have done if we hadn't had a word with the waitress...we got it for half. Disgusting. Be warned! But, if you turn right out of the hotel and walk down towards the Luxembourg Gardens, there are a lot of nice places for breakfast, infinitely cheaper than the hotel itself. Lovely apricot danish pastries from the take-away cafe almost opposite the Gardens, on the corner. Also - always take the Abbe de l'Epee exit from the Luxembourg metro - you can see the hotel as you exit the metro - the other exit is a long walk away!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: RhodyTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Observatoire Luxembourg for a week in mid-July 2005. We enjoyed the hotel. The location is wonderful, across the street from the Jardin de Luxembourg, and on the edge of the Latin Quarter and the Sorbonne area. The RER stop is just yards from the hotel, making getting around town easy. The RER covers much of Paris, and connects without extra charge with the metro system (a word of advice, on the RER you need to keep your ticket because you cannot exit the system without a ticket). The hotel itself was clean, although we did have a problem getting the air conditioning to work. The rooms were small, but that is supposed to be typical of the smaller hotels in Paris. There always was someone at the front desk, so we felt the hotel was safe. The front desk staff spoke English well, although the daytime desk staff were not overly friendly and seemed to get annoyed if you asked too many questions (the exception to this was the evening/night staff at the front desk, who seemed to welcome questions and enjoyed giving directions and helpful suggestions). We did not like the restaurant at the hotel (Le Luco) at all. You can do much better by taking a short walk to any of the hundreds of restaurants within walking distance. Overall, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Excellent Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Polar_Explorer
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Observatoire Luxembourg last weekend for two nights. The hotel was really easy to get to , just 35 minutes from Charles De Gaulle airport and literally next door to the subway exit. If you are looking at a short weekend break this hotel is perfect we arrived in under two hours from London. Being in the heart of the city the hotel is in the perfect location for exploring the city with all the major sights within easy walking distance. Suprisingly, condidering its location the area is very quiet at night. The restaurant 'Le Luco' ajoining the hotel is more than adequate if you don't want to venture out too far, you might find the menu limited but what is available is quality and with a fixed price menu of around 16 euros for a 3 course meal its excellent value too. A good choice for breakfast too, just 8 euros for coffee, orange juice, baguette, croissant, pain au chocolat, jam (all of it!). Having spent the weekend in Paris I honestly think it would be hard to find a better hotel at this price for location and comfort. The rooms, although they might seem small, have everything you need and are very clean, the staff are very helpful and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks traveling Britian, Paris, and Italy and this was our least favorite hotel. The staff was helpful and friendly unless you asked for an iron! Included in our stay was dinner at the resturant that is attached which was nice. We had a total of 3 rooms. My room had a shower with a very high ledge to climb over which was ok for me, but I'm sure people with any difficulting climbing in and out of things will not appreciate. The shower also leaked from the half glass door so it was scary climbing out and not slipping on the water with a sharp glass door in your way. I had two big windows that overlooked a small park and a quiet street. It was nice to open them up and enjoy the sounds of Paris while looking at the Pantheon. The other two couples had bed bugs which made for a not so happy stay. Overall it was an OK place, but the bugs lowered my score. It is VERY close to the RER.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Observatoire Luxembourg for 5 nights earlier this month (Jul 2005) and it was an adorable hotel! We booked online about a month in advance and paid 140 euros for a "deluxe double" room. Yes, the rooms were small, but for the price we paid - you'd be lucky to get a comparable room in New York. The hotel staff were friendly, helpful and fluent in English. The rooms were clean and neat with adequate closet and drawer space and the marble bathroom was clean and had everything we needed. We had asked for a non-smoking room and that's what we got. It had a beautiful view from our window of the Jardin de Luxembourg and the bed was comfortable. It was a great location on the Blvd. Ste. Michel. Within a few feet of the hotel was the Luxembourg metro station. For 1.3 euros we had an easy 35 min. ride back to CDG airport. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: hwfo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after checking out the comments of others on this site. We have stayed in Paris before and loved this location, across from the Luxembourg Gardens, next to the RER stop, and within walking distance of the Latin Quarter, Sorbonne area, NotreDame, etc. We love to walk the streets of Paris always finding something interesting and felt safe in this area day and night. The room was small as are Paris hotel rooms, but the bed was comfy, the bathroom new with instant hot water and the room decor very tasteful. We had a lovely garden view and the staff was informed and helpful. The desk in our room had a glass top that covered a Map of Paris so it was easy to check our bearings before leaving the hotel. Paid 13 Euro/person/day for breakfast (expensive, but very good) and 99 Euro/night for our room. The hotel charged us 145 Euro for the first night and 106 Euro for the last night without specifying the charge up front. We assume that the extra charge was to cover the cost of the reservation service. The total cost was as specified, but it was a shock. We would have preferred that both the Reservation Service and the hotel would have specifically noted the charge up front and not buried it in the total price. We would recommend the hotel and now that the Euro/dollar ratio is less than in April '05 the hotel is a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DianaCO
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel mid November. Extremely well situated for Metro/RER Station, only half an hour from Charles de Gaulle Airport, almost direct to your door. Pleasant, friendly staff and the bistro serves good food all day. The showers in the smallish rooms were great, one of the best I have used! Within a 20 minute walk of Notre Dame and close to shops and restaurants. The Luxembourg Gardens are lovely, and the attractions were quiet at this time of year. I would definitely stay here again.
